Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF INITIATION (also called "CIRCLE OF INITIAL INTEGRATION")
Introduction: This circle has a ceremonial character, in the classic sense of signaling the beginning of an initiation ritual, of something important starting. It represents the unity of the human community. The participants hold each-other's hands in the circle and dance following the music, which can be slow, affective, solemn or joyful. For Rolando, this was supposed to enhance affective communication. Progressively, more vital music were associated to this exercise, in order to stimulate humor and joy, right from the very beginning of the class.

Exercises.Name: SINUOUS CIRCLE
Introduction: Depending of the music, the sinuous circle can have different characteristics. For example, with the slow and tender music of "Tema de amor para Gabriela" interpreted by Gal Costa & Tom Jobim, or with "Ordinary Fool" by Paul Williams, the sinouous circle gives participants the opportunity to make a deeper connection with greater engagement (it will then be proposed in this manner to an advanced group).
The sinuous circle proposed with a joyful and euphorising music as "Aquarela Brasileira" by Emilio Santiago is especially useful for beginner's groups.
If the music is more active the possibilities of contact are reduced, and so the beginner participant does not feel intimidated but free and yet at the same time in connection with his companions.
The sinuous circle can also be proposed as a second exercise after the initiation circle.
Description: It can be used at the beginning or at the end of the class, it allows participants to greet each-other (to welcome at the beginning, to separate at the end).It is not a round circle, but more of a fluctuating and undulating shape, which allows people to get closer or further, offering the opportunity to look into each-other's eyes and eventually kiss each-other hello or goodbye.
CIMEBNote: To ensure that it runs smoothly, it should be noted that the overall movement of the group should be fluid, with participants being asked to :
- Avoid paralysing the round by prolonging contact with just one person.
- Avoid dragging others into movements that are too fast.
- Avoid forcing contact with a person who is a long way off in the circle, thereby dragging along the two closest people and interrupting the general harmony.

Exercises.Name: CIRANDA CIRCLE
Description: At the facilitator's invitation, participants do together and in rhythm with the music, gestures that evoke the movements of the fishermen. The Ciranda is a folkloric group dance from the Brazilian North-East. This circle can be very interesting when proposed during vivencias where group creative dances are proposed.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity of group coordination where all participants do the same gestures.

Exercises.Name: JOYOUS CIRCLE (playful circle)
Description: At certain times, depending on the vivencia (its theme, or the group) the circle can have a playful character, which promotes integration and joy of living.

Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF TRANSFORMATIONS
Introduction: Different circles of 6 people each are formed, and they all dance to the "Andante La Tempeste di mare" by Salieri, which is a joyous and yet subtle music. At certain moments, a person leaves the circle where she is and joins another circle. In this manner, people establish new possibilities of exchange and recreate new circles in constant transformation.

This exercise produces great joy and, symbolically, it represents what happens throughout the universe, where the exchange of energies or elements takes place inside or between different systems, as in different dynamic cycles of the cosmos.
The participants in each circle are invited to welcome the new persons with joy. In this global dance, when a person moves to another circle, she does it dancing and not walking or running.

Exercises.Name: CONCENTRIC CIRCLES OF GAZES
Introduction: This is a very important exercise, especially in groups of deepening vivencia. Indeed, people are not used to look in the eyes, which makes communication very difficult and communion almost impossible.

Participants are invited to form two concentric circles, one inside the other: those of the inner circle are facing outwards. Each person is faced with a companion to make contact with the eyes. At the beginning of the music, each round begins to move towards its own right, very slowly. People look in the eyes of the companions passing by them, naturally, innocently, without intent, without trying to express anything in particular by the gaze. One looks as one would watch a child in mutual recognition. Each pause lasts only briefly and then we connect to the next person's eyes.
The exercise ends when the two circles have made a full turn. We then invite the participants to embrace the person standing in front of them. This is an exercise in the line of affectivity.
Objective: Preparing people to establish a more intense bond or contact, because it is through the eyes, more than through words, that communication happens with more sincerity.

Exercises.Name: SWAYING CIRCLE
Introduction: On a slow and melodic music, participants hold each-other by the waist and gently rock or sway themselves together, so as to induce a mild state of semi-trance. People are invited to oscillate gently, in harmony with the group as a whole, as a unit, in order to access a vivencia of harmony in unity. This circle hence induces a vivencia of softness and affection, a sense of belonging without fear.
In the case of a group of beginners, we invite them to hold each-other by the hands rather than by the waist, so they can gradually overcome their reluctance or fear of contact.

Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF MULTIPLE CONTACTS
Introduction: In this circle, while holding hands, participants move and change their position by turning to one side or the other without displacing the circle, so as to come into contact or almost face the two people that are on either side (and with more distant companions if the circle is not too large). There is no displacement but just a gentle motion allowing the contact of faces and hair; and making possible the exchange of kisses. This is an exercise in the line of sexuality.
CIMEBNote: Description : Offering people the option of facing inwards or outwards (one out of two) facilitates and intensifies intimacy and multiple contacts. People never stop holding hands. Contacts are made through integrated movements of the whole body in motion.
Existential projection : Opening up to an undifferentiated affectivity and eroticism from which our preferences will emerge.

Exercises.Name: SWAYING CIRCLE WITH CLOSENESS AND CONTACT (Communion circle)
Introduction: This circle was formerly named "Circle of Communication"; however, it changed its name because the term "communication" seemed inadequate. Communication can happen by phone, by a gesture, an object, and does not really address the deep psychological process that takes place. Communication is, nowadays, closely linked to technological systems such as television, telephone, Internet, etc. The term "communication" does not convey anymore the idea of what we want to experience as a vivencia. In this sense it would be more correct to speak of "communion".
The name of this circle has therefore become: SWAYING CIRCLE WITH CLOSENESS AND CONTACT.

People hold each-other by the waist, oscillating together in harmony with each other and exchanging contacts through their heads that get close, their faces that brush against each other. A feeling of tenderness and mutual trust is produced.
This is an exercise in the line of affectivity in which we learn to give and receive messages of affection in feedback.

Exercises.Name: SLOW ACTIVATION CIRCLE
Introduction: At the end of the part of the class in which people are in a state of (somewhat deep) regression, the circle of slow activation allows for a gradual return to consciousness of identity.

Exercises.Name: ACTIVATION CIRCLE
Introduction: Towards the end of the class, in order to maintain group cohesion, it is convenient to propose an activation in circle. The intensity of the activation must take into account the physiological process and the vivencia of the participants, in order to be as progressive as possible and not to create disruptions.
Description: The circle of activation opens gently, the rhythm becomes more prevalent, and the movement becomes more vital. This may be a moment of farewell greetings (kisses).
Objective: To bring the group towards the final activation while generating a state of consciousness compatible with the requirements of external reality. The final activation must allow a celebration, a conclusion that is more than a simple motor activation.

Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF CELEBRATION
Introduction: It is proposed after a particularly significant exercice as "The Rebirth", after a challenge, or at the end of a weekly class or a workshop. Joyous classical music as the "Allegri" by Vivaldi is preferably used.

Participants turn while holding hands with arms raised in celebration. This circle is specially indicated at the end of classes and workshops on affectivity because it reinforces the feelings of brotherhood that were stimulated. It leaves participants in a triumphant mood.

When the Circle of Celebration is offered in classes devoted to the deepening of Masculinity, it is done with the music "Zorba," performed by Mikis Theodorakis, on which the men dance while expressing their full force.

Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF SOLIDARITY
Introduction: This circle takes place at the end of a session and the music must have something at the same time martial and triumphant as, for example, "Die Moldau" by Smetana. In his instructions, the facilitator should indicate that unity is a factor of strength, in order to open for participants a meditation on the meaning of the group, of fraternity and solidarity. The circle is punctuated with moments where the participants, seized by the vivencia, raise their arms in triumph.

Exercises.Name: FINAL CIRCLE
Introduction: The final circles have a quality of celebration, of warm and happy farewells.

Exercises.Name: SYNERGIC WALK
Description: It's a natural "walking in music", because walking in itself is integrated and in motor synergy. The left arm moves in synchrony with the right leg and the right arm in synchrony with the left leg. This synergy minimizes significantly the imbalance of the body, which spends less energy in the movement of walking.
Objective: To increase motor integration by enhancing involuntary synergy between legs and arms when walking.

Exercises.Name: PHYSIOLOGICAL WALK
Description: Walk by extending the first steps in a way to accentuate the movement of the buttocks, and then coming back to walk with the length of step which is natural.
Objective: Restoring the natural walk by integrating the movement of the buttocks and the hip joints.

The rehabilitation of a physiological walking regulates the whole motor function by restoring the appropriate tonicity, not only of the legs but also the pelvis, the chest, and the neck and facial muscles. It restores a more normal curvature of the spine and induces changes in metabolism, in urogenital function and in the cardiorespiratory system. It also has the effect of increasing self-confidence.
CIMEBNote: The aim is to walk with the whole body moving, accentuating the undulation of the pelvis and buttock muscles. To do this, we recommend that you walk with your supporting leg pushing harder, as if you were trying to push off the ground. You should also push one buttock against the other with each step.

Exercises.Name: WALK WITH AFFECTIVE MOTIVATION
Description: Overcoming the limits of a mechanical walk, so that the act of walking transforms into an impulse of totality (of the being) that springs to an objective: like a child who begins to walk and inclines the chest forward while extending his arms in front of him, especially when going towards a person it loves. This gesture of children indicates that the impulse of the walk is born from emotion.
The "vivencia" of impetuous joy that advances toward the world is inspired by the experience of the "flower children" of the sixties.
Objective: Recover motor-affective integration while walking. It is to walk with a mind open to the world, feeling the impulse that comes from the chest, which comes from the emotion induced by music.

Exercises.Name: WALK EXALTING OUR OWN PRESENCE (also called "Illumination of our own presence")
Description: The exercise consists of walking individually (one person at a time) through the center of the circle so as to be seen by all participants. Walking naturally but expressing the vital force, harmony, serenity, and joy. In reality it is an invitation to show the beauty of our own identity. This exercise enhances self-confidence and helps to manifest the strength of identity.
Objective: The exercise of walking while exalting our own presence stimulates the expression of identity. This is not about manifesting the ego, but rather about revealing by expressing it the plenitude of own identity, which is reflected in the assurance (the assured step) and self-confidence of our walk.

Exercises.Name: WALK WITH DETERMINATION
Introduction: Determination is essential in the progression towards goals. In most cases, when there is no determination, the richest projects do not withstand the adversity, obstacles or challenges that are sure to arise. On the existential level, the lack of determination can lead to dispersed behavior or to an easily influenced identity.

To be determined is to have a direction, to give an axis and a possible objective to our desires and our projects. The determined attitude is essential in gathering the necessary forces for the realization of our desires.
Description: This walk can be done collectively, and, in that case, people are encouraged to be sensitive to the movement of their companions in the group. It can be done individually (people walk alone one after the other), in which case the preparation of the participants (the courage to expose themselves at the center, and in view of the group) and the group (the ability to be present at a companions' vivencia) should be ensured. The second option requires a good vivencial preparation because it already has a character of challenge.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity to move forward with direction, goal and concentration. Build availability to face difficulties. Motor-affective integration.

Exercises.Name: SENSUAL WALK (sinuous)
Description: As any integrated walk, this is mainly a physiological walk, with emphasis on the undulation or "rolling" movement and a vivencia of seduction in walking.

Exercises.Name: JOYOUS WALK
Description: It remains a natural walk with synergy, but the accent is put on experiencing the vivencia of the joy of walking, with music in our hearts, our bodies, our steps.

Exercises.Name: ADAPTIVE WALK-DANCE
Introduction: Quite often, because of a lifestyle managed by the concern for performance, efficiency, and results to be achieved, we experience a pressure that cuts from the inner listening, that is to say, the perception of the needs of our organism, of our own bodies. Self-regulation is a sophisticated biological mechanism which offers us the opportunity to move in and around life in a motivated and regulated manner, either to immerse ourselves in passion and in achievement in action, or for us to surrender to voluptuousness, rest and pleasure.
Description: On the music that has highly differentiated periods between moments of rest and moments of activity, the person alternates between moments of motivated action trough walking or even dancing, and relaxing moments of pleasure with minimum effort by letting himself down gently to the ground. The return to action is "imperative" as to meet the emergency. Surrendering to pleasure is more "careless".
Objective: Reinforce the perception of self-respect. Listen to the expenditure of vital energy in our movements.
Stimulate the ability of an appropriated response to stimuli from the environment. Perception of self regulation in motion.

Exercises.Name: WALK IN SLOW MOTION (The astronaut)
Introduction: The sensitive perception of our environment thrives on the perception of our moving in the world. Being sensitive in a sensible world. This "walk" has no purpose, it allows for a smooth wandering, free of any concern to "get somewhere" but rather letting ourselves be carried by the current. Flow in the world.
The key words are: Fluidity, Smooth movement, Slowing down, Slide, To wander, To err, To idle, To slightly brush the air with our presence.
Description: People start with eyes closed, relaxing the shoulders, face, neck. They walk slowly, by placing the heel on the floor (and not the toe) with smooth firmness, with perfect synergy of the arms. The displacement is smooth, slipping, integrating the movement of the entire body.
Objective: To strengthen the ability to move fluidly and the ability to slow down with balance control, insurance at the base and flexibility.
Definition: This exercise belongs to the extension Biodanza for Children and Adolescents. It is sometimes included in vivencias with adults to raise their sensibility to slow motion and to stimulate balance, which is more difficult in slow walking than in brisk walking.

Exercises.Name: CLAPPING OF HANDS IN PAIRS
Introduction: The ability of eurythmy (being naturally together on the same rhythm: - ea-rhythmos meaning "good rhythm") is essential in human communication and in the experience of cordial social relations. It occurs easily in the easiness of playful situations in which people find the lightness and innocence of the child in them.
Description: The two persons, face to face, recreate the situation of a game that most have practiced in childhood.
Following the rhythm, they clap their hands with enthusiasm and spontaneity, allowing for "overflowing" beyond the simple hand movements. We can suggest one or two changes.
In this exercise, it is important to synchronize together and maintain the rhythm at all times.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity to synchronize on the rhythm with another person and the capacity of motor coordination (motor and audio-motor integration) in a playful context (communication).

Exercises.Name: GAME IN GROUPS OF THREE OR FIVE
Description: With an objective similar to the "mirror game in pairs" the persons form groups of three (or five) and each one at a time creates movements in coherence with the musical variety while the other two (or four) follow and adopt his initiatives.
Objective: To stimulate creative expression and the ability to play, leaving behind the fear of being ridicule.

Exercises.Name: GAME OF VITALITY
Introduction: See "Game of samba and vitality in a group"

Exercises.Name: GAMES OF SAMBA AND VITALITY IN A GROUP
Introduction: Playful situations encourage a spontaneous contact between people and contribute to group cohesion. They prepare the atmosphere of trust, complicity, and lightness, allowing them to abandon themselves together in the proposals requesting more intimacy. These playful situations naturally stimulate the joy of living and sharing.

These are exercises with an euphoric effect that develop the link in a playful atmosphere, not very engaging while conductive to exchange, contact, synchronization of the movements and rhythms. This is also very conductive to overcoming timidity (in taking the initiative for rapid change of partner, for example).

It is the music that suggests the context of the game. The facilitator invites people to dance freely with contact and interaction, with changes in circumstances creating a phenomenon of surprise, a slight chaos of playful nature:
Examples of possible games:
Dance in pairs with very quick changes.
Dance in small groups miming each-other.
Dance in pairs, with one single person who will quickly choose a partner during the change, when the group number is odd (Now or never).
Cadenced circle with change of place passing through the center.
Trains with changing of "driver".
Objective: To get out of stereotyped movement, to explore transgression.

Exercises.Name: ONE, TWO, THREE, FOUR
Description: The facilitator indicates that to each number will correspond a different situation:
One: participants dance individually.
Two: participants dance in pairs.
Three: participants form one or several small trains.
Four: participants form small circles.

The game is about alternating all of these situations by saying aloud and in a playful manner a different number each time. The facilitator is here the animator of the situation, surprising the group by mixing the order of the numbers, repeating them, or modulation the duration of each situation.
Objective: To facilitate, on a playful mode, the integration of the group, adaptation to changes in situations, and capacity to take the initiative.

Exercises.Name: NOW OR NEVER
Description: The facilitator ensures that the group is an odd number, so there will be pairs who dance together and there will be one person without a partner. Everyone dances to the rhythm of the music. In an unannounced manner and at rather short intervals (to keep the surprise effect), the facilitator cuts the music for a second or two. Individuals must then rapidly change partner, without thinking or being selective but just "catching the opportunity". This game creates a situation of joyful and delightful chaos, bringing people to dance with each other very freely.
Observation: Instead of saying that one person will remain "alone", we can say that it will be "available".
Objective: As Rolando Toro often said, "we need to learn to act twice before thinking". The objective is to meet the opportunities that life offers on the basis of our spontaneity, our impulse, and our desire.

Exercises.Name: "CAMINANDO" CONTACT GAME IN GROUP
Introduction: Always based on playful dynamics (the spontaneity and innocence of the child, the surprise of unexpected chaotic situations), the proposition is to facilitate a situation where participants touch each-other, surpassing the taboos related to touch.
Description: Participants are invited to dance freely in rhythm with the music and in a relatively small space to avoid a scattering in the dance space. When the facilitator calls for a body part, each person places each of his hands on the body part named of two other people nearby. This is done while continuing to move and to jiggle in rhythm with the music. The facilitator unexpectedly mixes in "'anodyne" body parts, ranging from the easiest to the most compromising in accordance with the capacities of the group.
Objective: Integrating the capacity to touch in a lightweight and uncompromising situation. Facilitating the affective integration of the group.

Exercises.Name: CONTACT GAME (Cumbia)
Introduction: Game inspired by a music genre with a long history in the South American folklore and in its African origins, which generated popular dances in many Latin American countries.
Description: This game allows for different playful situations in a group, with movements mimed the lyrics of the song "Me gusta tu rosa roja", where the facilitator guides the game: the participants dance together, very close and on the rythm of the music; then, the facilitator announces certain phrases that are sung by the interpreter:
Arriba las manos: people dance raising their arms.
Abajo las manos: people danse lowering their arms.
Las caras juntitas: dancing cheek against cheek (with one person or changing partners).
Besito in the frente: a kiss on the forehead (with one person or changing partner).
Abrazo al hermano: hugging our brother (changing partners).
Silencio profundo: deep silence (the finger on his lips  chuuuut - with the corresponding body gesture).
Gritos al mundo: shout to the world (whistle, cheer, shout - with corresponding body movement).
Y ahora al coro: and now all together (people dance in pairs, body to body, with spontaneous changes, until the end of the music).
Objective: To get out of stereotyped movement, to explore transgression.

Exercises.Name: GAME OF THE CHINESE FAN IN PAIRS
Introduction: look down, why are you looking at me...), because the gaze speaks about us without it always being possible for us to control the content that is perceptible by spheres other than those of reason. What we're trying to rehabilitate in Biodanza is the natural communication that takes place between two people through their gaze, enabling them to re-establish the bridges that make it a true opening to essential perception. From being a simple 'objective' perception of things in the world, it becomes a binding force.

One of the first approaches will be to facilitate both playful, spontaneous communication situations and situations that dissolve the tensions linked to the difficulty of being sincere. So, for this last part, we will be relying on segmental movements, on the intimate connection with oneself, and on everything linked to the expression of emotions: motor integration, affective-motor integration and communication. But we don't have to put the emphasis on eye contact, which would only make things more difficult.
Description: To put an emphasis on the affective aspect, the two persons are placed facing each other and they slightly "veil" their eyes and their faces with both hands, leaving their fingers slightly apart as a kind of perforated screen or as a lace fan. Through the interstices, in a sensitive dance, their eyes are looking, and the bodies sometimes approach and sometimes move apart. Gradually, as confidence comes through the connection, the hands move apart revealing more of the face and the eyes, until a total "unveiling". Participants will then contemplate each-other in their entirety and find a way to establish a harmonious dialogue in which they can hug or dance together (by introducing elements of creativity while maintaining the connection through the eyes).
Objective: The aim of this dance is to tame the gaze in a way that is both progressive and emotional. It's also about taking the time to be discovered. It allows you to reveal yourself and discover the other person gradually.
CIMEBNote: Although the exercise is called a "game", it does not exclude the quality of the vivencia which must be of connection, sincerity, feedback in the relationship. Sincerity is without severity, but it is still real. The game is sincere. It is actually a "game of progressive revelation in feedback."

Exercises.Name: THE TRAIN
Introduction: The train provides a playful way for the group to experience a vivencia of contact, according to different levels of closeness and intimacy based on the distance between people, on the semantics of the music and on its duration.
Description: The participants place themselves one behind the other, holding by the waist, with more or less proximity and, following together the rhythm of the music, they move forward by synchronizing their rhythm and their movement.
Observation: This exercise can be very interesting to integrate the group, to introduce sinuous movement and central rhythm, and to promote (depending on the music chosen) self-regulation. It also provides a passage from a more active time of the vivencia to a softer one.
Objective: To facilitate contact and group eurythmy.

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC DANCE
Introduction: The bodily perception of rhythm results in integrated body movement, i.e. the ability to move in adequacy with the cadence of the music. The movement clearly expresses the cyclical recurrence of this cadence and repeats this pace, without body rigidity or mechanical repetition. The vivencia of rhythm participates in the audio-motor integration and facilitates relationship in feedback. Rhythm perception and its expression are reduced or disrupted in cultures characterized by a kind of sedentary lifestyle in which dance and percussion are not part of the musical or gestural heritage.

On a clearly rhythmic music, people dance freely with movements that focus on cadenced repetition of movement, in accordance with the rhythm of the music, and differentiating between stronger (marking the tempo) and milder moments.
Description: It is dancing on a simple rhythm, with small jumps, moving through the space of the room.
Observation: As rhythmic music has a great diversity of styles, we can use other pieces of music apart from those mentioned above.
Example of music:
- "Oh Lady be good", Benny Goodman.
- Doctor Jazz", Traditional Jazz Band
Objective: To stimulate rhythmic capacity through auditive-motor integration. This exercise also promotes agility.
CIMEBNote: With a clearly rhythmic music, people dance with free movements but emphasising the cadenced repetition of the movement according to the rhythm of the music, and the differentiation between the strong beats (which mark the tempo) and the weak beats. The first impulsion must be clearly perceptible by the movement of the legs and feet. The flexibility of the knees and pelvis (real anatomical locks when they are rigid) allows the rhythm to spread, like a wave (more or less sinuous) according to the music, throughout the body.

Exercises.Name: EXPRESSIVE RHYTMIC DANCE
Description: Participants dance inventing expressions and movements to a music which is mainly rhythmic, but also containing a discretely significant melody.
Objective: To reinforce rhythm, expressivity, auditive-motor integration and emotion. The pleasure to dance is the door which gives access to integration: it is a force that organizes the movement.
CIMEBNote: Do not forget to mention self-regulation (speed and acceleration can be modulated without loss of expressivity).

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC DANCE WITH CENTRAL MOVEMENTS
Introduction: On a rhythmic music, people are encouraged to initiate the response to rhythm with movements coming from the belly, pelvis, and trunk. (In the West and for most people, peripheral movements of arms and legs with a certain rigidity in the trunk are often predominant).
Observation: Ask people to keep their eyes open and not to shake their heads.
Objective: Integration of rhythm and visceral sensitivity. Rehabilitation of mobility associated with central coenesthetic sensitivity (proprioception).

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC DANCE WITH PERIPHERAL MOVEMENTS
Description: On a rhythmic, expressive and very vital music, people are invited to respond to the rhythm of it with peripheral movements (arms and legs).
Observation: Ask people to keep their eyes open and not to shake their heads.
Objective: To stimulate the vitality of movements trough rhythm.

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC DANCE ON BATUCADA
Description: Batucada means "percussion". It is about dancing with a vivencial emphasis on rhythm.
Objective: To intensify the vivencia of rhytm and stimulate the auditive-motor integration of the "percussive" elements of music.

Exercises.Name: DISPLACEMENT WITH LIGHTNESS (Expressive dance with levity)
Description: The participants move to the rhythm of a waltz or melodic jazz piece, occupying the entire space of the room with lightness, levity and flexibility.
Objective: To reinforce the capacity of displacement with easiness and vital impulse. To stimulate the capacity of self-regulation.

Exercises.Name: INTERPRETATION OF MELODY (Melodic expressive dance)
Introduction: This dance is part of the free expressive dances and thus belongs to the exercises on the category of creativity and expression.
Description: The creative dances are aimed at developing expression and capacity to innovate, all in an interaction between motivation, pleasure and spontaneity. This dance is particularly relevant to the interpretation of the melody of music in all its expressive nuances. Very often, during the free expressive dances, the emphasis is on the rhythmic impulse, on the expressive freedom, the joy, the liberation of creative intensity, etc... The "Melodic Expressive Dance" gives priority to all melodic, fluid, affective, aesthetic, symbolic and interpretive features of the music. Melodies are, in music, what lets through sentimental depth, affective expression, romantic expression, a sense of continuity, along with an intense and fluid pulsation. To dance the melody means "to live", to feel, to be the music in its most intense way and receive the most intense feeling it conveys.
Observation: The melodic expressive dance is mainly manifested through pulsating opening movements of the chest, by pulsing and nuanced movements of the arms, with expressive variations and with a significant modulation of the tonicity of hands and wrists. The vivencia promotes the ability to express one's own feelings in all their shades and intensity.
Objective: To develop expressive capacity, in terms of depth and intensity, of yin-yang pulsation, of action and responsiveness; as well as integration between perception and motricity, feeling and expressing.
CIMEBNote: However, it is important to avoid the 'recitative' mode, in which the gestures are simply a transcription of the score or the melodic phrasing.

Exercises.Name: SYNERGIC JUMP
Description: This is an exercise of motor integration that is done by is moving around with small jumps while maintaining the natural synergy between the arms and legs, following the rhythm of the music. The group is placed in a circle thus creating a central space in the room. Each participant can do it individually at its own initiative, moving to the middle of the circle, and can do it from one to three times depending on the size of the room.
It can also be done with two to three participants at a time.
Observation: It is necessary to prepare participants for the realization of the Synergic Jump with progressive muscular warm-up exercises (Walk, Rhythmic coordination, Rhythmic synchronization, for example). Jumps must be made smoothly and it is absolutely necessary to avoid sudden movements that can cause a twisting of the ankle or a rupture of the Achilles tendon.
Objective: This exercise belongs to the line of vitality and aims to enhance motor integration. It is done with eyes open.

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC VARIATIONS
Description: Participants begin walking in rhythm in order to warm up the muscles, and then jump rhythmically and with synergy.
The dance is created on the basis of four movements:
1. walking in rhythm
2. bouncing or skipping in rhythm with synergy
3. skipping while turning on oneself (with open arms)
4. skipping with sideways opening of the legs and simultaneous movements of the arms, which open and close on the chest, while looking alternately at the foot that rises from the ground.
Objective: To acquire a repertoire of rhythmic movements in order to introduce an element of creativity in the dance. To stimulate vitality (the joy of living).

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF MAXIMAL EXTENSION
Introduction: As its name suggests, this dance is an invitation to perform movements with the whole body (arms and legs), expressing the maximum potential of extension and stretching.

The realization of this dance requires a voluntarily guided muscular effort, with a continuous control of the movement, tonicity and balance. From a choreographic point of view, the visual effect of this dance has a high figurative quality, this is why it also applies to the line of Creativity, while being above all an exercise of corporeal integration.
Observation: Participants should be invited to do this extension without putting their hands on the floor for support, but in total balance on both legs. Weight and support changes in the legs can take place when needed to keep balance throughout the dance.
Objective: Activation and softening of the tendons, muscles and joints. Stimulation of motor integration and balance.
CIMEBNote: The existential projection of this exercise is that motor integration confers a sensation of expansion, as the person goes beyond the narrow confines of narrow movements.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF HARMONIC EXTENSION
Description: The Dance of Harmonic Extension consists of amplified and harmonious movements. It deals with voluntary movements of the arms, which take place slowly in a way that creates a feeling of harmony. These movements should be rounded, avoiding angular gestures. Eventually the movements may appear as if the person is stretching. This dance should take place with the eyes open and with the possibility of closing them sporadically when the vivencia intensifies. This exercise integrates conscious and vivencial functions.
The final subjective effect is a feeling of harmony.
Objective: To re-establish the modulating function of the cerebral cortex, generally hyper-stimulated by an uncompensated and disharmonious lifestyle.

Exercises.Name: INTEGRATIVE ELASTICITY
Description: The exercise of Integrative Elasticity consists on slowly rolling on the floor, extending and contracting with flexible movements that engage the entire body. This is a very important exercise considering its integrative effect, which comes from a continuous variation of muscle tonicity. In effect the rolling movement is composed by a succession of different positions or members and articulations, each one of which elicits a different level of muscle tension.

The alternation between tension (stretching) and relaxation (contraction) allows the dynamic integration of the arms and legs to the trunk, which are generally dissociated from each other. The essential condition is that the movement engages the entire body and not isolated parts, in a way that creates a general state of corporal elasticity.
Objective: To stimulate motor integration through variations of the levels of muscle tension.

This exercise requires a level of muscle tension that can be supported by the body in a harmonious way, without falling. It has an effect of postural rehabilitation: the activation of muscle tone in an integrative manner reinforces the normal function of body support, which is held by the entire muscular system.

Exercises.Name: BREATHING DANCE
Introduction: In the exercise of Breathing Dance that I developed, breathing is not normative as the form proposed in the

Tai Chi Chuan (which is modeled on a rigid scheme where inhalation and exhalation should match a precise movement and a predetermined respiratory rate, that is the same for everyone), but rather a cenesthetic breathing in deep connection with oneself.
Description: For this exercise, one must connect to oneself and become sensible and aware in order to perceive the natural rhythm of one's own breathing.

Through a soft and harmonious dance, with a music structured mainly on melody, one evokes the happiness of breathing, without voluntarily intervening on his own breathing so as to avoid the aggression, through voluntary actions, of the natural breathing process.

Instructions: We stand relaxed and with eyes closed. Then we start very sensitive movements with the arms, in harmony with our own natural rhythm of breathing. It is not necessary for the gestures to coincide precisely with inhaling and exhaling. There is no need to intensify them.
Objective: The objective of this exercice is the respiratory vivencia in itself.

Exercises.Name: ABDOMINAL BREATHING
Introduction: This is the only other breathing exercise that exists in Biodanza in addition to the "Breathing dance".
Description: This is an exercise that is done in pairs. One of the two participants lies on his back on the ground while the other, sitting or kneeling beside him, gently lays a hand on his abdomen, below the navel. In this way, he accompanies the natural ascending and descending movement of the abdomen during breathing.
This exercise is done without music.
Objective: It is mainly used as an exercise in respiratory rehabilitation.

For many people, the tendency is to breathe with only part of the lungs, in a way so that the diaphragm is rarely involved and loses its natural flexibility, which gradually reduces the amplitude of the breathing wave.
This tendency generally indicates that the individual is in a condition of oxygen deficiency.

Anxiety, fear and states of tension paralyze the diaphragm, and breathing becomes insufficient. And in a sort of vicious circle, the sensation of suffocation increases the anxiety. This exercise therefore restores a natural, full and deep respiratory function.
FLUIDITY

The exercises of fluidity have certain similarities with the movements of Tai Chi Chuan, but in their aim, in their limbic-hypothalamic genesis and in their vivencial effects they are completely different.
One of the important effects of the exercises of fluidity is deceleration and organic harmonisation.
Fluidity is a category of movement contrary to rigidity.
The aim of the dances of fluidity is to stimulate the vivencia of integration with the universe. For this reason fluidity is considered the royal path to reach the vivencia of ecstasy.

The capacity to allow the continuous flow of energy. The movements of fluidity commit the entire body in a process of sensitive displacement in space, in a way that produces a tactile connection with the air.
People who have fluidity of behaviour easily avoid obstacles. Rigid people, on the contrary, are blocked by them and constantly live with the useless expense of energy.
In the course of corporal adjustment, which is verified during lovemaking, fluidity has the very important function of intensifying sensation in order to form a single body with the other.

Fluidity elevates the quality of human relations on the intellectual, affective and sexual levels. As a result there is an increased flexibility in communication and the disposition toward resolving conflicts when they occur. There is also an improvement in the reciprocal adaptation of the bodies during the sexual act.
Fluidity is a universal category of movement. It can be observed in nature: in the rivers, the wind and the movements of such animals as the snake, the tiger and fish.

Fluidity is a characteristic of water, which alchemically represents the dissolution of solids and whose psychological equivalent is the power to find a solution to conflicts. Water chemically dissolves salt, creating a solution. People who symbolically have a great deal of water as a personal characteristic, which means they have fluidity, have a better capacity for resolving problems.

Exercises.Name: FLUIDITY: SEQUENCE 1
Introduction: The Sequence of Fluidity 1 stimulates the connection to oneself, in the sense that it raises awareness of the harmony that can exist when the movement finds a perfect synergy.
The movements of fluidity of are carried out in a slow and continuous manner.
The sequence of fluidity is used to prepare for a free dance of fluidity and other dances of sensitivity and creativity.
Objective: To stimulate a sensitive connection with oneself.
CIMEBNote: When the complete sequence is integrated and mastered, it also encourages the yin/yang integration of the movement.
DanceStages: 1 Initial position
Standing with feet apart in the spacing of the pelvis, the arms are naturally released along the body.
2 First stage

Forward movements with the arms and hands, the palm facing down. The arms must remain parallel and flexible at the elbows and wrists. Arrived at shoulder height the arms come down, with palms facing forward in a gesture of "caressing the air." This movement is done back and forth continuously. It is important to ensure that the arms remain flexible at all joints and that the amplitude of the movements remains natural at all times. Accompany this flexible back and forth movement with a corresponding bending of the legs.
This first stage is repeated a few times.
3 Second stage

The movements of the arms and hands is similar to those of the first stage, but this time in an alternating manner (right arm forward, left arm back, and vice versa). The legs can separate a little, and keep the same flexibility (as in the first stage).
This second stage is repeated a few times .
4 Third stage

The movements of the arms and hands is on both sides the body. If it starts to the right: the right arm is placed in a receptive "yin" position (as a hoop, or rather as if we supported the head of a child in the hollow of the arm), during which time the left arm, in a "yang" position, penetrates it with palm open as if pushing the air. During the realization of movement of the arms, the upper trunk rotates towards the same side at waist level. The movement is reversed to the other side. The "yin" arm becomes "yang" and the "yang" arm becomes "yin".
This third stage is repeated a few times.
5 Third stage (alternative)

The pivoting to the right is realized on the heel of the right foot, toes raised, knee bent. Most of the body weight rests on the other leg (which is also bent). The pivoting to the left occurs in the same way, pressing firmly the sole of the right foot to the ground. To this leg movement corresponds the arms movement as is described in the third stage.
This stage is repeated a few times.

Exercises.Name: FLUIDITY: SEQUENCE 2
Remark: The Sequence of Fluidity 2 induces the musical vivencia of opening to the surrounding world (the others).
The gaze follows the whole time the movement of the arms and hands.
The movements of fluidity of are carried out in a slow and continuous manner. The sequence of fluidity is used to prepare for a free dance of fluidity and other dances of sensitivity and creativity.
DanceStages: 1 Initial position
It is the same as described for Sequence 1.
2 First stage

The arms are parallel and without rigidity, and they move to the right as far back as possible, then slowly to the left. The arms are low and slightly separated from the body. The hands, sensitive, "caress the air" and "open to the world". The leg movements follow this semi-rotation with flexibility (as described in the Third stage of Sequence1).
This first stage is repeated a few times.
3 Second stage
The movement is the same as for the preceding stage, except that the arms are almost to shoulder height.
The hands are always sensitive and caressing the surrounding air. The movement of the legs is the same as for the previous step.
This stage is repeated a few times.
The second stage can be enhanced with the proposition to bring the two arms on one side, then they go down, then raise to the other side, in a continuous movement that invites to raise the eyes.
4 Third stage

The arms are parallel, with palms facing each other, and they rise above the head without rigidity and without lifting the shoulders. Both arms then come down on each side (the right to the right and left to the left) in a broad gesture of opening. The palms are always facing outwards. The legs can optionally be separated a little more.
This stage is repeated a few times.

Exercises.Name: FLUIDITY: SEQUENCE 3
Introduction: The Sequence of Fluidity 3 can increase dynamic equilibrium and the perception of one's own energy.
The movements of fluidity are carried out in a slow and continuous manner. In the specific case of the
Sequence 3, the movement may eventually accelerate slightly due to the increase of vital energy.
The sequence of fluidity is used to prepare for a free dance of fluidity and other dances of sensitivity and creativity.
Objective: To increase dynamic equilibrium. Activation and renewal of the vital energy, which means an increase in vital energy. Perception of ones own bipolar magnetism: the bipolarity of magnetic energy. Bipolar magnetism is the magnetic tension among the different parts of the body.
DanceStages: 1 Initial position
It is the same as described for Sequence 1.
2 First stage

The right arm (elbow bent) and the right leg (knee bent) rise at the same time until the elbow and knee touch. The foot position is slightly "flexed" (toes up) and the palm of the hand is facing forward (Yang position). The body weight rests on the left leg which is slightly bent. Repeat the same movement with the other leg and the other arm.
This movement is repeated a few times, alternating right and left.
3 Second stage

The arms open to the sides, to the height of the shoulders and in alignment with them. The arms then do a movement inspired by the wings of a windmill, along with rotations and the bending of the waist forward, backward, right and left. The legs are slightly bent and remain flexible to accompany the movement of the body.
This movement is repeated a few times.
4 Third stage

The magnetism of the hands. The right hand, palm up, is placed at the level of the basin in the central axis of the body (just below the navel). The shoulders are well relaxed. The left hand, palm down, is at the level of the chest, near the body. This is a resting position, with no other tension than the magnetism flowing between the two hands. In order to better become aware of this magnetism, the palms are gently brought together and moved away from each other, it then begins a movement of the magnetic sphere (formed by the space between the two hands) to the right and left, where the position of the hands is reversed (each hand is alternatively on top or at the bottom of the sphere)
This movement is repeated a few times.
5 Free dance
The three successive stages induce a free dance with fluidity, with basis and displacements.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF FLUIDiTY WITH IMAGES
Description: The Dance of Fluidity with Images has a mimicking character and is a poetic gesture. Some gestures have a great expressive purity. The following have been chosen for the demonstration of this dance:
- Opening a door
- Indicating a cloud
- Opening a window to the sky
- Indicating a bird in the sky.
In the instruction the teacher suggests that the students create their own gestures, freely using their own imaginations.
Objective: Integrating movement with consciousness. Ideo-motor integration. Giving reality to the imagination, and opening up our movements and dances to the world of the imaginary. Stimulating creativity.
CIMEBNote: Our body language is often impoverished by the lack of freedom for authentic self-expression and by the routine nature of most of our daily actions. Our thoughts and imaginations are dissociated from what we do and feel. This dance facilitates the connection between imagination and sensitive creation, inspiration.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF FLUIDITY IN PAIRS
Description: This is the most important exercise of corporal adjustment between people, because it allows a dynamic adaptation of the bodies in each moment. When two people corporally encounter one another and one is fluid while the other is rigid, it can be called a "disencounter". Fluidity in Pairs represents the most perfect communion and reciprocity in the corporal encounter.
Objective: To sensitize people to sensual adjustment. This adjustment diminishes egocentrism, as it brings about a mutual and reciprocal protection within the movements. When it is possible to flow in pairs, one enters a sincere state of loving ecstasy.
Poetic_element: The vivencia of Fluidity in Pairs is like navigating through the body of the other.
Existential_projection: Lovers who can flow have the chance to be happy, as each one accepts the initiatives of the other.
CIMEBNote: Description : Two people dance very close to each other, face to face. Their dance is created by a sensitive contact between them and each, as if moved by her own sensitivity, slips into the spaces left available by the movements of her partner. In a way, the two people are "navigating" each other's body movements.

Exercises.Name: FREE DANCE OF FLUIDITY
Introduction: It can be said that a person who dances with fluidity is a person who knows how to dance.
Description: Participants move in a slow, harmonious movement of the whole body, and not just the legs. Synergy (between the legs and the trunk) is respected, the movements are round and the displacement of the base (the feet) are in a subtle game of balance and imbalance. We recommend to people to bear their step and weight on the heel and not on tiptoes when changing place. Evolution does not happen exclusively forward and in a straight line, but randomly, exploring all spatial levels (vertical, front, back, top, bottom). The dance takes place entirely in a standing position, and is characterized by the stability of the base, the lightness of the upper body, and the freedom of movement and modulation in muscle tone between yin and yang moments.
Objective: To put the vivencia of fluidity into practice, displacing oneself in space in a fluid and sensitive way. To learn to dance with grace, harmony and levity.

Exercises.Name: FLUIDITY IN GROUP WITH SENSITIVE CONTACT
Description: This is the first step toward acceptance of diversity. It is a subtle form of contact, with affective and transcendent elements. It has an undifferentiated element, oriented toward an intra-species communion.
This dance is about flowing delicately, displacing oneself among companions. The contact that is established is of a fleeting nature. It produces a medium-level regressive effect.
Objective: To continue the acceptance of diversity. In this way it transforms racist pathology into social intelligence, which means tolerance and sympathy in relation to different people.
Poetic_element: It is the vivencia of navigating through the human species and feeling the instinct of the herd, which means the instinct of intra-species solidarity, which is the foundation of affectivity.
Existential_projection: The acceptance of diversity enriches ones personal life, because it permits interaction with people who have very different characteristics and who provide the nuances of their own identity.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF HARMONIC OPPOSITION
Description: The two people are facing each other, placed so as to feel the stability of their base, with legs apart and knees flexible as to lower the center of gravity of the body. The torso is upright, for better concentration of force in the belly. The two people place their right forearm, elbow slightly bent (like a shield) before them.

The contact is therefore done by the forearm, as in a position of fight. The vivencia is rather oriented towards confrontation, but there is always a search for harmony and recognition of the strength of one another. There is never any violence.

Throughout the dance there may be a displacement of the feet in order to maintain self-balance. It should also be indicated that leaning the torso forward upsets the balance necessary for the manifestation of a powerful tonicity.

Alternative: There may be a variation of the position. The two people join their hands, palms against palm, with tonicity and total adherence. Connection is made in the gaze that expresses the determination to position itself with power, and in mutual complicity. People exert a pulsing pressure in their hands, which allows for a pulsing movement back and forth involving the whole body. The goal is not to "push down the other" or "show who is stronger", but to allow a genuine dialogue that is both affective and powerful.
Objective: This dance has the objective of enabling participants to express the yang and powerful part of their tonicity while meeting the equivalent in the other. This is a subtle and affective dialog between two forces that gradually blend and harmonize. Affectivity always comes out winning. This dance is also intended to learn to express our differences facing others, and to listen to them. Done with perfect feedback, in order to achieve a progressive equilibrium through successive adjustments.
Definition: The dialogue that develops between two people when in contact or when they touch is made up of various elements among which the perception of tonicity is essential. Tonicity may be light and guide the dialogue toward gentleness, it can be heavy and make the dialogue intense, or it can be powerful and moving towards some sort of confrontation. The degree of tonus informs us each of the emotional, psychological and relational orientation of the relation that takes place. Opposition is one of the many facets of the encounter in the relationship to another: it provides information on the divergence of positions and on the determination that a person may have to assert his own position. Opposition is harmonious when it opens the door to dialogue, allowing to establish a eutonic symmetrical pulsation: everyone is understood in what he has to express, even with force, and nobody is animated by a desire to negate the other. The ability to experience a vivencia of opposition without breaking the dialogue nourishes mature affectivity.
In every relationship between two healthy, strong and assumed identities, there are times when we oppose.

Our ability to live these moments with serenity is part of the recognition of our own dignity and that of the other. This capacity disarms the violence generated through the frustration of not knowing how to position ourselves. This dance is somehow the "yang" version of the "Dance of eutony of the hands". Here, both are in contact with their own strength, but it is not intended to undermine the other. They both harmonize the encounter of their respective powers through tonicity.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF EUTONY (Eutony of fingers)
Introduction: The Dance of Eutony takes place through the union of the index fingers of the right hands of two people.

The dance is slow and sensible, with small steps that contribute to the character of lightness. It is important to keep the fingers together, in spite of the eventual changes of position generated by the displacements during the dance. This exercise requires affective communication through the eyes. Eventually the eyes can close when the emotion becomes more intense.

Exercises.Name: EUTONY OF HANDS
Introduction: The Dance of Eutony of Hands is done by uniting the palms of both hands and, in this position, dance in search of a common harmony. Initially, one can apply a certain pressure to the palms of the companion in order to reach perfect connection. Then, they can do creative variations around the initial movement, and taste the multiple possibilities of the eutonic pulsation.

Exercises.Name: EUTONY OF FEET
Description: Eutony of the Feet takes place by uniting the soles of the feet. Lying on the floor, two people connect the soles of their feet, seeking to maintain a distance that permits a common movement, as when riding a bicycle. They can then do creative variations on the initial movement. The entire exercise takes place very slowly.
Objective: To stimulate the sensitivity of the feet and sensitize people to the tonicity of their legs. The posture also the effect of stimulating the irrigation of the internal organs of the pelvic and abdominal areas.
CIMEBNote: It's important to ask people to regulate the distance between them and the distance between their legs so that the position doesn't cause muscle tension in the legs, thighs and back during the exercise.

Exercises.Name: EUTONY IN GROUP OF THREE
Description: Three people form a small circle, united by the index fingers, and dance with very slow and harmonious movements. During the dance two people approach each other while the third, without letting go of the fingers, protects the relationship between the other two.

This situation is repeated successively, in such a way that each of the participants assumes the role of the third who protects the relationship. This produces a form of affective communication without competition, with an element of complicity, in a way that creates a possibility of giving affectivity a social dimension of sharing.
Objective: To stimulate the opening towards a form of affective communication that is without competition or rivalry.
This is done by adding a layer of complexity: the third person. It is in the triangulation that a relationship of two opens to the world.

Exercises.Name: EUTONY OF THE ENTIRE BODY
Introduction: The Eutony of the Entire Body takes place through the frontal union of two people. In this frontal contact it is necessary to completely adhere to each other without the use of the hands, seeking to form a single body in movement. The movements should be very slow, in very precise feedback, allowing the conservation of the perfect adherence of the bodies.
Objective: Balance the muscle tone, so that the level of tension and relaxation of the person can regulate itself. Get acquainted with the tonus of the whole body in a position where there is at the same time balance and full contact, so as to modulate the pressure and the weight.
CIMEBNote: This exercise needs to be prepared for by raising awareness of the ability to slow down, and of feedback.

Exercises.Name: CIRCLE OF EUTONY
Description: The members of the group form a circle connecting the index fingers of both hands with the index fingers of their neighbouring companions, making slow and harmonious movements and seeking to maintain the eutonic union of the fingers during the entire exercise. The general effect of this exercise is a fluid, graceful and light circle that suggests the idea of a happy and harmonious human community.
Observation: In order to avoid that people feel too cramped and that tension is created in the arms and shoulders, we invite them to adjust the distance between them (if more space is needed) to move with more ease. The dance is done with eyes closed.

Possible variation: one person in two turns outward. In this setting, the union of the indexes seems easier and allows for a greater proximity between people; it may therefore be proposed when the group is comfortable with the intimacy of contact. This variation is also realized with closed eyes.
Objective: To increase coordination and harmony among participants of the group.

Exercises.Name: SAMBA IN A GROUP OF FIVE (Eutony of hips in a group of five)
Introduction: Close contact and cadenced rhythm are two elements of the pleasure shared in the group. This dance is not about "dancing the samba," but about pulsating in unison with the others, the others' bodies, with an undulating rhythm and on a sensual music. For some people, the fact of feeling the movement of their companions on both sides can help them feel their own movement: to slow when they are accelerated, to move the pelvis in resonance with the movement of group (while for some this can be difficult to do alone).

The situation of undifferentiated contact allows to more easily surrender and to regain a sense of belonging and complicity. This situation contributes to removing guilt and drama from situations of contact and from having pleasure in such contact.
Description: Participants form circular groups of five people, they hold by the waist and approach so as to reduce any gap between them and feel their hips in contact. With the music, the cadenced movement of the pelvis (slowly rotating in eutony with the two closest persons) gently spreads to the whole circle. People close their eyes and surrender to the collective undulating wave. The knees are relaxed, the eyes are closed and the pelvic movement is smooth and continuous. It is possible to rest the head on the shoulder of one neighbour.
This version of the exercise can be done with a larger number of participants (six or seven).

To propose a deeper version of this dance, a person goes to the center and lets herself be carried by the undulating movement of her companions whose bodies stick to hers. Smoothly, people will alternate going to the center, at the invitation of the facilitator. Depending on the number of participants in the group, it is also possible to do this exercise with 4 or 6 people.
Objective: Motor integration by mobilizing the pelvis. Preparation for the undifferentiated situations of a compact group.
Erotic-affective integration.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF SENSITIVE ARMS
Introduction: This is an exercise in the line of transcendence, its objective is to sensitize the arms through a deepening of the sensory-motor integration (between sensitivity and motricity). It is a dance where the slow and sensible movement of the arms predominates, where there is no voluntary impulses (these are minimally present only at the beginning of the exercise).
Description: The movement of the arms implies a slight participation of the trunk. The exercise is done without moving in space, relaxed and with eyes closed.
Objective: Sensitive-motor integration.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE WAIST (Poetic Name: The Reed)
Description: In this dance the movement is done with feet legs close together (in order to limit the surface of support on the floor). The arms are above the head without lifting the shoulders, the eyes are open and the body oscillates like a reed moved by the wind.
Objective: To integrate the upper body with the lower body, in order to recover such unity in the individual often dissociated at the waist level. This dissociation is typical of hysterical and obsessive neuroses, which are themselves the consequences of sexual repression.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE NECK
Description: Slowly rotate the head, continuously and in the same direction, with neck relaxed, eyes closed and mouth semi-open, in order to evoke the vivencia of abandonment (of letting go). During the rotation of the head, which must be slow and gentle, it is important not to force the extension backward. The facilitator asks participants not to "force" the movement, that is to say not to make the movement "in force", but with sensitivity and tenderness for oneself.
Objective: To dissolve the muscular tensions which are, in many cases, chronically present. Such dissolution is possible with this slow movement done with eyes closed, which results in the stimulation of the parasympathetic way of the vagus nerve, inducing a feeling of deep relaxation, of semi-trance.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE SHOULDERS
Description: Rotate the shoulders from front to back in a continuous movement, with eyes closed and mouth semi-open, evoking a vivencia of liberation, as if we are liberating ourselves from a state of tension, of an excessive weight.
Objective: To relax the muscles of the shoulders and the dorsal area, which are generally tense due to defense mechanisms and feelings of oppression.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF CHEST-ARMS
Description: This dance is about passively moving the arms, which receive the impulses that come from emotion. The arms do not make intentional movements; they move as a reflection of the impulses that come from the chest. At the beginning, place hands on chest, feeling the emotion of the music. Then delicately open the arms so that they move based on the stimulus coming from the impulses of the chest and the emotion of the music.
Objective: To induce affective-motor integration, which means allowing for the movement of the arms to begin in the chest and not at the shoulders. The objective is to feel that it is the emotion that organises the movement of the arms, allowing a sincere expression.

Isadora Duncan was the first to place the center of the dance in the chest, introducing the affective dimension into dance. When the movement of the arms is dissociated from the chest, it suggests that the actions are purely mental.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE PELVIS
Description: It is the realization of the following sequences:
- Backward movement of the pelvis (in an angled tilt as if you pulled the buttock muscle to the back)
- Lateral movement (side tilt and balancing)
- Anterior-posterior movement (front-back tilt and balancing)
- Rotation movement (turning hips always in the same direction)
The entire sequence is done with eyes closed, mouth semi-open, evoking the erotic sensations of diffuse bodily pleasure.
Objective: To activate and harmonize the movements of the pelvis, which is generally tense or even blocked due to a state of chronic tension resulting from sexual repression.
CIMEBNote: Participants can place their hands on their own body to better feel their own movements.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE NECK IN PAIRS
Description: The person who will do the movement is placed in the same position as that described for the individual Segmentary Movement. The person who will accompany stands in front (close enough to convey protection, but without impeding the movement) and laying his hands on both sides of the base of the head (under the ears, and slightly behind the face). The hands are shaped as a cradle, soft, tender, and stress free. The arms are detached from the chest and without tension. The contact is not symbolic, it is real while being light. The person accompanies the movement of the partner without guiding it. Care should be taken not to lead, nor to limit the movement. The important thing is to invoke a vivencia of protection and benevolence.
Both people have their eyes closed.
When the music ends, the accompanying person offers a containing embrace, with gentleness and depth.
Then, without speaking, the two people exchange positions to conduct the reciprocal situation.
Objective: In terms of affective-motor integration, the objective of dissolving the tension is the same as for the same exercise done individually. An objective of relational-affective integration is added, which is to enhance the capacity of abandonment and trust in the other, and the ability to support and be supported. Where the individual Segmentary Movement stimulated a mild form of self-induced trance, the shared Segmentary Movement promotes a light trance induced by affectivity. For one to experience the abandonment, the other looks after and cherishes as a protector.
CIMEBNote: There have been opportunities where, doing this exercise, Rolando Toro proposed that the accompanying person stands behind.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF THE SHOULDERS IN PAIRS
Introduction: All considerations about instruction and context are the same as for the previous exercise. It is the quality of the relationship and the trust that is mentioned here.
Description: The accompanying person is behind the one who will do the movement. The hands are placed without weighing on the shoulders, in a position that cradles and tenderly wraps each shoulder. Following the impulse to move of the person performing the dance, the accompanying person, with the sensitivity of his own movement but without directing, confers more amplitude to the movement. The accompanying arms are light and mobile so as not to block but instead follow the movement, as light and subtle as it may be. At the end of the music, the dancing person can gently bend backwards, resting her head on the shoulder of her "protector." This short time can contribute to strengthen the feeling of protection and the expression of gratitude.
Then, as in the previous exercise, a containing embrace is offered.

Exercises.Name: SEGMENTARY MOVEMENT OF CHEST-ARMS IN PAIRS
Introduction: All considerations about instructions and context are the same as for the previous exercise. It is the quality of the relationship and the trust that is mentioned here. The vivencia is one of protecting and being protected. Depending on the vivencial level of the group and the theme of the class, this dance can become an invocation of the guardian angel or protecting angel.
Description: The person who will do the dance takes the position of intimacy, eyes closed, hands on his chest. The accompanying person is behind with the palms of her hands resting gently on the partner's forearms, near the hands. The hand's contact should not weigh but establish a real contact which is light and does not limit or imprisons, while not being a caressing of the arms either. When the music starts, the person dancing begins to realize a pulsating movement of openness and connection to oneself, then gradually abandons this regular pulse in order to blend in with his dance, with the intimate perception of a total continuity between the impulses coming from the chest and the movement of the arms in response. The movements are slow and delicate, with light tonicity. The accompanying person, by empathy, becomes the perfect double of this movement by following with his entire body.

As in the previous exercises, at the end of the music and after a moment during which the person can slightly lean back (as if receiving a hug from behind) and lay his head on the shoulder of the companion, he will be received in a frontal embrace before proceeding to the reciprocity of the exchange.
Objective: Doing a dance that integrates the chest (deep affective motivations) and the arms (motivated and integrated action) while being accompanied without being guided, helps to restore confidence in authenticity: we can express ourselves sincerely and continue to be loved. So that authenticity becomes a value to be integrated into our relationships.

Exercises.Name: MOTOR INTEGRATION OF THE THREE CENTERS
Description: The person dances in response to the invitation of the music with undulating movements which start from the hips (a slow rotation of the pelvis) and gradually involve other centers (the chest and head and, by extension, the legs and arms) in a harmonious and cadenced way. The movement becomes a sort of wave that crosses the entire body.
Objective: To integrate the motricity of the segments activated by different segmentary movements, by promoting a vivencia of unity and harmony. From a functional standpoint, it helps stimulate the neuro-motor efferent functions, that is to say, the neurological pathways that go from the motor centers of the brain to the muscles. From a vivencial perspective, a vivencia of unity and harmony can be experienced.
Remark: To rhythmic music like "Aquarela brasileira" (Emilio Santiago), the dance is more "active" and we sometimes call it "cascading motor integration".

Exercises.Name: CENESTHETIC INTEGRATION OF THE THREE CENTERS
Description: The participant is invited to dance the music with sensitive movements, evoking sensations of cenesthetic pleasure, with eyes closed and mouth half-open. Reducing peripheral and voluntary movement promotes central and sensible movement.
Objective: To integrate sensitivity, that is to say the neurological pathways that go from to the skin to the internal organs. To evoke a vivencia of cenesthetic pleasure, of the pleasure of moving.

Exercises.Name: RYTHMIC COORDINATION IN PAIRS (Walk in pairs)
Description: In pairs, walk together holding hands, following the cadence of the music. During the exercise the facilitator will propose several changes of partner .
Objective: To walk in perfect coordination with another person, maintaining the same rhythm and reciprocal harmony.
To develop adaptive capacity through coordination with the other and awareness of its presence.
Existential_projection: To stimulate the ability to create the path together. To get out of individualism (of walking our path alone) and move towards complementarity.
CIMEBNote: f two people feel awkward or uncomfortable walking together, they can take initiatives such as changing hands, changing direction, finding out how it could be better. We can play it down by saying that it's not always easy to find this syntony and that sometimes it's more "creative" or "chaotic" with certain people, but that the essential thing is to savour the pleasure of discovering this relationship together that is coordination.

Exercises.Name: DANCE IN PAIRS WITH FEEDBACK
Description: Both participants start dancing in the conventional position: one of the two takes with his right hand the companion's left hand, while placing his left hand around his waist; the companion poses his right hand on the left shoulder of the first. Regarding the position, it is also possible to do this exercise by holding both hands (facing one another) or in the position of embrace.
Observation: This exercise is proposed with music which is structurally mainly melodic.
We can also propose the "Dance in pairs with feedback" with tropical rhythms such as mambo or forro (a music that has a swaying cadence).
Remark: This exercise is proposed with music which is structurally mainly melodic, with a slightly swaying cadence.

Exercises.Name: DANCE IN PAIRS ON TROPICAL RYTHMS
Introduction: When the "Dance in pairs with feedback" is proposed with tropical rhythms such as samba, forro or mambo, the exercise is called "Dance in pairs on tropical rhythms". Thus, for the description, refer to the previous exercise.

Exercises.Name: MELODIC SYNCHRONIZATION IN PAIRS
Description: Standing facing each other and holding hands, the two people dance in an harmonious way by following the melody of the music. Rhythm is relegated to a less important level, the affective interaction with the other becomes more important. The eyes can be open or closed according to the intensity of the emotion.
Objective: To stimulate affective communication with the other through melody. Coordination and affective-motor integration with the other.

Exercises.Name: RYTHMIC SYNCHRONIZATION IN PAIRS
Description: Standing in front of each other, holding hands and looking into each other's eyes, the two people do rhythmic movements on the music, in a synergic way and with small steps in their dance. Sometimes the facilitator proposes changing partners.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity to dance on the rhythm with someone, reinforcing synergism and stimulating rhythmic capacity. It's an exercise of integration with the other.

Exercises.Name: BATUCADA WITH VOCAL EXPRESSION
Introduction: Like the preceding exercise, this one also strongly stimulates vitality and seeks to invoke the wild and primitive side of the human being.

It is an individual dance that can be performed individually (only one person dancing in the center of the circle) or by several people simultaneously. During the euphoria of the dance, participants emit a spontaneous cry or call, a spontaneous and natural expression of their voice.

It is important to arrive at issuing the cry naturally and with strength, avoiding artificiality (a sound guided by will or dramatized). In other words, the person must ensure that their call is genuine and consistent with both the music and the movement.

To structure this exercise, Rolando Toro was inspired by the Afro-Brazilian rhythms such as the BatucadaFantastica and certain rhythms by Guem. The African rhythms of David Fanshawe as "African Sanctus" are also very suitable.
Description: Batucada means "percussion". It is dancing with a vivencial emphasis on rhythm.
Objective: To intensify the vivencia of rhythm and stimulate the auditive-motor integration of the "percussive" elements of music by adding the voice. To stimulate the expression of rhythm through voice.
CIMEBNote: This exercise is more appropriate for Minotaur Project.

Exercises.Name: DANCE WITH INTENSITY
Description: Participants are invited to dance with the intensity that overflows, that goes beyond, that radiates and warms. Without saving energy. To meet the needs of natural self-regulation they are invited, if the need arises, to reduce the amount of movement when tired without reducing their intensity (so as not to confuse intensity with speed or quantity). Intense movement does not mean a lot of movement.
Objective: To recover the intensity of expression. The key word "intensity" has as etymological origin"in-tendere", that is to say "soft inside". To dance with intensity is a kind of radicalization of our ability to tend to and reach inside of the present moment through the surrender to the music and to our total response to it.
