Existential_projection: Normalizing education tends to extinguish our rich expressiveness, especially in the intensity of its manifestation. We need to recover it: speak with intensity, feel with intensity, give ourselves intensely.

Exercises.Name: DANCE IN THE CENTER OF THE CIRCLE
Description: Participants form a large circle, leaving the center empty. Each one, under the momentum of the impulse to respond to the invitation of music, dances in the center. The modalities may vary depending on the intensity of the music (to respect self-regulation), the intensity of the challenge of seeing and being seen, and the number of participants:
1. People go in in small groups (spontaneously) and dance with intensity for a few moments before returning to the circle,
2. People dance individually, one at a time. This modality is more confrontational and demands that the courage to show oneself without losing the natural expression be already integrated.
Objective: To stimulate the courage of expression: to see and be seen in the full self-expression of self-enhances self-esteem and valorisation of everyone in the group. At a group level, the objective is to discover the diversity of expressions, and confirm the importance of such diversity.

Exercises.Name: CREATIVE DANCE
Description: Participants dance freely on the contents of the music. There is an increased visibility of the emotion of the dance. It is therefore not only about feeling, but about creating oneself in the movement, in the here and now. This dance can be a good preparation for the Musical Radicalization (Musical Mediumnity) because it opens to a space of freedom.
Observation: Depending on the content of the music, the expression will find many different shades (fantasy, playful, erotic, ludic, profound, passionate, overflowing, etc..)
Objective: To stimulate spontaneity and expressiveness through a movement that is free, nuanced and creative, without concern for formal aesthetics but rather coming from the vivencial aesthetic of freedom of expression.

Exercises.Name: CREATIVE DANCE IN PAIRS
Description: The dance is done in pairs with great freedom of initiative, of possibilities of distance, contact and variations consistent with the musical and relational stimulation. The dance can have a playful or choreographical value, according to the chemistry between the music and the relationship.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity of coordination with the other in the realm of expressivity.
Definition: Coordination is the syntony and synchronization of all movements. It is the status of systems oscillating at the same frequency or capable of transmitting or receiving waves of the same frequency. Refers to a person whose state and behavior are in perfect harmony with its environment.

Exercises.Name: THEMATIC CREATIVE GROUP DANCE
Introduction: The Thematic Creative Group Dance allows to transform and overcome the tendency to think that creativity is an isolated individual act, in order to perceive that one can be creative in interaction with others and respond together to a specific stimulation.
Description: These are collective dances in which participants interact on their own initiatives, improvising different situations based on the theme proposed by the facilitator. The themes are playful or choreographic, such as: Exaltation of the joy of living; Expression of the vital eroticism; Celebration of the freedom of being.
Objective: To develop the ability to create movements from a proposed theme and to keep in synchronization with the movements of the other participants in the group. This exercise stimulates the rhythmic-motor-auditory integration and links the personal expressive impulse and affective communication with the others present. It integrates creativity and affectivity.
Definition: Refer to Creative dance in pairs.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF AFFECTIVE EXPRESSION
Introduction: Integration of affectivity and creativity with a dance in which the starting point is the emotion of music and its expression through the movements from the chest. It is an expressive variation of the Segmentary Movement of Chest-Arms, which is more delicate.
Objective: To integrate sensation, emotion and expression. Integration of affectivity and creativity.
Poetic_element: When our whole being is filled with the emotion of the music, the "overflow" becomes an irrepressible expression of our inner abundance.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF EXPRESSIVITY
Description: This is a dance in the line of creativity, in which the emphasis is on expressiveness: the movements are diverse, corresponding to the emotion that emanates from the music.
Observation: Particularly suited for individuals who have already completed the initial phase of the motor and affective-motor integration process.
Objective: To increase the ability to be perceived. To stimulate the courage to show oneself and accept being seen. To strengthen the capacity of expression in a rich range of nuances. The expression is therefore not only stimulated by the beat of the music, but also by all the nuances it may contain.

Exercises.Name: MEN'S DANCE OF SEDUCTION
Introduction: This is a rehabilitation of genital sexual identity. The seduction is expressed in an undifferentiated way: each man expresses his seduction to all women, not one. At the end, women embrace men.
Description: Women place themselves in a group in the center of the room and men dance around them expressing their seductive power.
Objective: This exercise aims to rehabilitate seductive behaviors and movements of seduction of men towards women; it reinforces the sense of gender self-worth: to assume oneself as a man in face of women. To assume their own power of seduction and enhance self-esteem.

Exercises.Name: WOMEN'S DANCE OF SEDUCTION
Introduction: Expression, by women, of specific movements of sensuality and seduction of men.
Description: There are different possibilities. In the first one, men are lying on their backs throughout the room or forming a star; the women dance while moving among men, seducing them all.

The second possibility is to place men in two rows and the women dance in the middle, advancing in a movement of seduction towards men. This seduction must be undifferentiated, it is about seducing men and not one man.
Objective: To rehabilitate the natural behaviors of seduction and decrease the level of guilt.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF SEDUCTION
Introduction: Integration of the lines of sexuality and creativity: expression of the instinct of seduction.
Description: People dance together with movements and expressions that indicate the intention to seduce. The dance can be done in pairs, with or without changes.
Objective: To dare to be seen, attracting to oneself the presence of the other, exercising natural magnetism at the service of seduction.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE HORSE
Description: It's a lively trot with movement through the space of the room. The music, "Dark Horse" by George Harrison, has the cadence of the trot of a horse. It is a dance of activation and in a sense it is also joyful. This is a specific exercise in the line of Vitality.
Objective: To adapt the movement to a rhythmic music which, unlike other rhythmic music, refers to the trot of a horse and suggests the corresponding gestural mimicry. It allows to find a playful expression so, in this sense, the dance also belongs to the line of Creativity.
CIMEBNote: This is a dance of the vitality line, combining power, lan, ardour, tonicity, agility and speed.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF BREAKING PATTERNS
Introduction: This is a dance in the line of creativity in which people seek to leave the "formal" movement and explore freely what the "strange", uncommon or peculiar music evokes.

Exercises.Name: DANCE FOR THE OTHER
Introduction: Connecting to our own dance under the eyes of the other, and offer our dance, offer ourselves completely without loosing anything but instead being enriched and enhanced by our dance for the other.
Description: The two people choose each-other on the basis of affinity and the connection that emerged in the moment.
One sits in a contemplative and receptive position, connecting to its ability to receive the other in his dancing, that is to say, in the manifestation of his identity.

The other dances in front of him, from the impulse of the emotion generated by the music, both for herself (motivated by her own pleasure to dance) and offering this dance (by the simple fact of receiving the contemplation that is offered, of knowing that her dancing is received, it has a destination, it reaches the other). When we stop observing the expression of the other but instead get his emotion, his vivencia, his dancing, so affective and unconditional, we have access to her essence.
At the end of the dance, the person who has contemplated offers an embrace and the situation is reversed.
Objective: This exercise aims to stimulate the capacity to honestly express ourselves facing the other, thus opening a space for sincere, profound, intimate and light communication. It also has the effect of repairing the negative experiences related to self-expression, fear of judgment, the tendency to judge, while stimulating the courage to be, to disclose under the gaze of a person, and the ability to look at the other with empathy by learning to receive the movement of the other as a total expression of its identity.
Integration of affectivity and creativity.
CIMEBNote: The choice of music will be guided by the vivencial nuance that is most appropriate for the situation of the group and the capacity of expression and intimacy of the participants.

Exercises.Name: LIBERATION OF MOVEMENT
Introduction: People have little opportunity to freely explore their expression through free, ample, total and spontaneous motion. This results in a restriction of creativity and an overall inhibition of creative expression, but also of expression in general, becoming a kind of "constraint", an inhibition. Without free movement throughout the body, it is difficult to achieve the release of tensions and expressive blockages of all kinds. Freedom is, above all, moving freely without concern for performance.
Description: On a playful, vital and expressive music, people dance freely, daring to occupy space and expressing their feelings induced by the overall atmosphere of the music. The dance is creative and expansive and invites to break free from the limitations to expression.

When the music is very vital and long it should be shortened, or participants should be invited to exert self-regulation (when one feels signs of fatigue, one can reduce displacements or the intensity of movements, which become less peripheral).
Objective: Regain the spontaneity and the creative impulse that seek no results nor performance.

Exercises.Name: FLEETING ENCOUNTERS
Introduction: The present moment has a precious quality, which is presence. But we often go through these moments of life in a state of anesthesia, as if stunned. Everything seems "normal" and "acquired". Each instant is then only another moment in our arithmetic existence. So it is important to find the sensitivity to the value of the moment, a value that one cannot possess but that is lived. When two people really meet, regardless of the duration of the encounter, so fleeting it may be, they are transformed.
Description: When the music starts, people slowly approach each other, meet by the gaze and the outstretched hand.

Both tend the same hand (right or left). The touch is light and sensitive. The encounter is fleeting and yet people are encouraged to be fully connected to what they are experiencing in the moment. The current of encounters is continuous and allows for a vivencia of feeling the strength and the fugacity of every moment.
Objective: To stimulate the ability of being fully present at each moment. Bathing in a continuous current of presence.
Valuing the present moment, our own presence and that of others, here and now.

Exercises.Name: ENCOUNTERS OF HANDS AND EYES
Description: Two people approach each other progressively and take each other's hands, looking into each other's eyes.
To separate from each after the encounter, they slowly move away with a subtle gesture of farewell.

Exercises.Name: ENCOUNTERS WITH EMBRACE
Description: Two people approach each other progressively, looking into each others eyes, until they embrace. After a moment of affective interaction, the two slowly separate with a delicate gesture of farewell.
Affective communication takes place in a progressive way, through gestures of acceptance and welcoming.
These signals are transmitted through the eyes, the smile and the gesture of receiving.

Exercises.Name: PULSATING ENCOUNTERS
Description: The pulsating encounter (pulsation in the intensity, in the proximity, in the tonicity, in the dialogue) implies that there is previous integration of feedback, so that two people can establish a harmonious dialogue in which both listen to the potential of the other and to their own desire, and can express it fairly, naturally and "vivencially", without having to think.

Exercises.Name: TRANSCENDENT ENCOUNTERS
Description: From an posture of openness and great availability, people meet by taking plenty of time to contemplate the face and the eyes of the other. It should be allowed for the vivencia of connection in the eyes to gain intensity before merging or fusing into the embrace. Tis embrace should be of total acceptance.
Transcendent encounters are not the expression of a desire but of an unconditional availability.
Objective: To induce an essential perception of the other and of the encounter, in the sense of an epiphanic revelation.

Exercises.Name: A MINUTE OF ETERNITY (FOREVER)
Introduction: "In one year, so many things happen that fall into the trap of everyday forgetfulness. But one can remember for years a single kiss that lasted only a few seconds" (Rolando Toro).

Simple intimacy originating from total presence to self and to the other in the encounter is a moving vivencia of powerful connection. Often, when people approach each other or when they hug, they don't really feel the dimension of the gesture: in the embrace our hearts come closer, the affective energy of one blends with that of the other and a unique living unit is created. The vivencia of intimacy is the gateway to authenticity: to receive and to be received unconditionally for what we are invites us to build sincere relationships, those that arise on the basis of simplicity, where we have nothing more precious to offer than ourselves, whoever we are.
Description: Two people, beginning on an immediate syntonization of their mutual gaze, approach each other and embrace in a complementary way: heart to heart, with the three centers in contact. They stay motionless, without swaying, without caresses, without any kind of movement other than the embrace. The depth of this fleeting moment, which lasts only a minute in chronological time, can be projected into eternity because each has become part of the other: the here and now is the whole time and space of the vivencia. Every second has the value of eternity.
Objective: To stimulate the capacity to be fully present in intimacy, to provide a presence that gives more presence.

Exercises.Name: EPIPHANIC ENCOUNTERS (Connection to the other's angel)
Introduction: Epiphany is the sudden revelation of the greatness of life in quotidianeity, which leads us to the amplified perception of reality and puts us in contact with the sacredness which is present in all that exists. It is the illuminated understanding of the divinity of the world, of the supranatural nature of love as the greatest miracle.
Description: Participants are invited to follow all the stages of the encounter in Biodanza (already described in the introduction to the Exercise Group "Encounters"), and to amplify the sense of the encounter as a loving epiphany.
Objective: Through the encounter and the revelation of the sacredness in the other, to experience the vivencia of "epiphany of love", the revelation of the sacred in ourselves.
Poetic_element: When the wave of emotion of seeing the essential beauty of our friend takes over us, we are in epiphany.
This dance allows for us to, through the sensible perception of the divine in the other, be able to contact the divine in ourselves.

Exercises.Name: DIVERSE ENCOUNTERS
Introduction: Under the name of "Diverse Encounters" are proposed (when the group reached an important level of feedback), situations of encounter in which people respond freely to their vivencia (in coherence with the context of the session and the music). The facilitator does not indicate any special modalities for these encounters, as is the case with the other exercises in this group.

Exercises.Name: BAPTISM OF LIGHT
Description: Participants stand, facing each other. The one who receives the baptism remains in a receptive state with eyes closed, while his companion raises his arms over his head and slowly lowers them in an attitude of transmitting his own light.

The gesture is like the placing of hands, with a gentle contact of the palms sliding on the body of the companion from the head to the feet and then from the shoulders to the hands (without grabbing them).
At the end of the exercise, suspend the contact for some seconds; this deepens the vivencia.
After a brief embrace, the partners change roles.
Observation: This exercise is a ceremony of giving, not of healing, therefore it takes place only in front of the person receiving and is done only once (the movement is not repeated).
This may produce healing phenomena, although this is not the goal of the exercise.
Objective: To awaken the feeling of human sacredness through the exercise of our capacity for self-donation.
The symbolism of the light represents the human feelings of generosity and kindness. Transmitting ones own light means giving the other the best of oneself.
This exercise is a form of transcendent communication, considering that the manifestation of generosity is only possible when we transcend our own egos.
CIMEBNote: This exercise has two levels of validation: for the giver (connecting to the best and brightest of his identity), and for the recipient (its presence is recognized and exalted, illuminated). The quality of light is to make visible what would otherwise remain in darkness.

Poetic Element: Sometimes we are more sensitive to our own inner light. Benevolence on the other, its availability and openness, operate a complete reversal and allows us to open ourselves to all light of the universe.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF MINIMUM CONTACT (dance of sensible contact)
Introduction: Feedback, in a situation of contact, opens to a great subtlety in the exchanges. But often, when people are enthusiastic or when they are not very sensitive, the contact they offer in the encounters can have a bit of a rough, heavy, insistent quality, which is not in itself a defect but may sometimes not be appropriate for certain more delicate situations.

The light touch, sensible, aerial, minimal, at the very edge of the skin, is a contact that allows a type of transcendent vivencia, as it opens the perception of bodily boundaries. Perception takes the quality of a "membrane perception"; a diaphanous touch of the yin type that makes the skin very receptive. Often, a light touch better predisposes people to being touched than a more penetrating kind of stroke.
Description: This is a dance that is done in pairs, facing each other but not too close, with a very slow movement of the arms which, in so doing, produces a subtle and delicate reciprocal touch. It is done without displacement in space, with eyes closed. The movement of the arms slightly involves the upper body. The two people dance slowly, with light arms and with hands gently touching in an undifferentiated manner, that is to say without dwelling or emphasizing on a body part in particular. The dance has the quality of fluidity and lightness of air.
Observation: The aim of the "Dance of minimum contact", like the "Dance of sensitive arms" and the "Silent syntony", is to prepare the participant for deeper contact exercises.
Objective: To sensitize the skin through a light touch, in a light tonicity; to facilitate the vivencia of fusion with the environment by having the perception of diffuse corporeal boundaries; to perceive the essence of the other "through the skin" (which is more than a container for identity) which helps reduce the anxiety of wanting to "own" the other and impose a form of deep contact without sensitivity and feedback.

Exercises.Name: HEART TO HEART DANCE
Description: In the position of complementary embrace (each of the two has one arm around the neck or above the shoulder of his partner, and the other arm around his waist, under the armpit), so the two persons are entwined chest against chest (or heart to heart). With closed eyes, moved by the invitation of the music and the intimate situation, they make slow and soft movements like a alternated swinging, oscillating back and forth. Gradually, as they are syntonized, they abandon this balancing that gives way to a pulsating movement of their bodies, in a vivencia where they become one body.
Objective: Symbolically offering one's heart to another being and achieving a vivencia of affective fusion.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING OF HANDS IN A GROUP OF 5
Introduction: It is an exercise in undifferentiated affectivity. Indeed, the caress of the hands, in this anonymous context, raises sensibility about the variety of possibilities present in the group: different skin temperature, texture, consistency, tonicity, etc.
Description: Participants form small groups of five and are placed in a tight circle. Each participant holds his hands toward the center of this small circle placing them alternately (superimposed) on the hands of his companions. Everyone closes their eyes. When the music starts, the heads gently move closer and the hands begin to move sensibly until they essentially become soft and light caresses that are offered and received anonymously. Participants are encouraged not to hold or grasp the hands of their companions.
Objective: To experience the vivencia of the opportunity to love and cherish through caresses without knowing who is the recipient of our affective impulse. To open up to undifferentiated love.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING THE BACK IN PAIRS
Description: People are invited to pair up. They can either stand or do the exercise lying on their stomach, and one at a time receive the caresses on their back. One of the two offers a gentle caress on the back of the other. This caress should not turn into massage (focusing on specific points). It is an act of protection so that the recipient feels accompanied and protected. The lying down position requires a very good ability to trust and surrender in the group.

The exercise ends when the music ends. The two people embrace each other to seal their complicity with gratitude. If they are doing it lying down, the one that received the caresses will be received with great caution in an embrace. The caress is always received in a receptive attitude with eyes closed. In the case of the person offering the caresses, the attitude must be protective (the eyes may be open or closed, provided that the person is always careful to look after the welfare of his partner who receives the caresses).
Objective: To stimulate the capacity to give and receive protection and affective care. To stimulate the capacity to surrender to the pleasure of a caress.
Remark: As it was said above, the situation of taking turns in caressing allows people to deepen, on one hand, their ability to surrender and to receive, and on the other hand, their ability to give tenderness, protection, and pleasure.

When this exercise is realized in the lying down position, it would be necessary to help the person to turn onto his back in order to receive a containing embrace. For the right position to be adopted to provide this embrace, see the description for the exercise of "Giving and Receiving containment in pairs".

Exercises.Name: CARESSING OF HANDS IN PAIRS
Description: After choosing each-other, participants are placed face to face holding hands, and begin with offering each-other a subtle caress of the hands. In an integrated movement, the body participates of this caress in a swaying, rocking pulsation induced by the music. When the emotion intensifies, they can close their eyes and surrender to the pulsing dialogue in which their hands caress through different levels of intensity. The contact should be pulsating and have the characteristic of a sensitive or passionate caress, but never be rigid.
Objective: This exercise can raise a surprising type of vivencia of great intensity, as it is induced by the connection between the two persons, two energy centers which slowly merge into a single and more powerful energy.
And that is how the transition from contact to caress is made, which gives access to the vivencia of communion.
CIMEBNote: It is particularly appropriate to propose this exercise as a preparation for a vivencia requiring greater sensitivity, confidence and commitment in the differentiated relationship. Many vivencias for two are an initiation to contact and eutonic dialogue with the other. However, the transition from contact to caress opens the way to vivencias of great intensity and to an otherwise powerful dialogue.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING OF FEET IN PAIRS (alternated)
Description: Two people choose each-other to do this exercise together. One of them lies on his back with his eyes closed in order to receive, and the other sits at his feet, placing them on his thighs. Both feet are then caressed at the same time, and contact is maintained throughout the duration of the music. When the emotion is intense, the person offering the caress can close his eyes. Caresses are pulsating, varying between lightness and intensity.

At the end of the music, the person who offered the caress places himself as to receive the partner in a sitting heart to heart embrace. Movements should be very soft and tender for this accompaniment towards activation in the embrace. Then the roles are reversed.
Objective: Many are the Biodanza exercises which are proposed in order to invite people to temporarily give up the strength of the Self in order to experience an attitude of deep devotion towards the other. The vivencia of devotion and humility conceals a force that exalts the beauty of the two participants: of the one who receives the honor of the caress as well as the one offering it. We could also describe this vivencia as a search for communion with a particularly deep quality.
Remark: This experience has a power that not only beautifies the person receiving the caress, but also the person who offers it. We can also consider that the caress is an exchange that establishes a deep communication between people.
Existential_projection: This is an act of love, where a human being manifests love to the humanity of each individual. When Mary

Magdalene washes Jesus' feet and dries them with her hair before anointing them with oil, she establishes with him a deep and mysterious connection in which there is neither arrogance nor ostentation but a mixture of humility and love, full of sweetness and tenderness. In fact, caressing the feet of a loved one is a ceremony of an extraordinarily profound connection.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING OF THE FACE IN PAIRS
Description: The two people facing each other caress each other's face (forehead, cheeks, ears, lips). The situation is very intense in vivencia terms and it also contains elements of consciousness. Indeed, by their caresses, both become aware of the shape of the face of their partner, its sensitivity, texture of his skin, but above all the nuances that tell and express feelings, moods and complex experiences: suffering, sadness, sensuality, innocence, wonder, expectation, etc.
Both people have their eyes open and look at each other with intensity, but when the vivencia deepens, they spontaneously close them.

This caress can be done either according to the modality of reciprocity (both people offer each-other simultaneously the caresses of the face), or according to the modality of alternation (first one and then the other to surrender successively to the caress of their face).
Objective: To learn to delicately caress a face is a very important achievement in life. When we caress the face of a person, we caress and cherish its identity as a whole, and we realize that every face has its own beauty: a beauty that is not about its shape or appearance, but an emotional beauty, an expressive aesthetic.
CIMEBNote: Reciprocal caresses tend to be more sexual in nature, whereas alternating caresses are more emotional. It is a highly differentiated ceremony. Getting to know the other, who is unique and different, through caressing.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING ONE'S OWN HANDS
Introduction: Some people are always turned outwards, towards "doing", they forget themselves in the actual world of efficiency, caring only about what is useful and never taking time to be with themselves. This exercise can trigger an intense vivencia in these individuals, because in the tender union of the two hands, a powerful field of exchange of affective energy is created.
This is an exercise in the line of Affectivity.
Description: From a deep connection with herself, the person slowly approaches her hands one to the other and lets them interact with affection, through sensitive and delicate caresses. Both hands can at times hug, sway together. The eyes may accompany the caress or they can be closed.
Objective: To enter into affective contact with oneself. The possibility of contact between the two hands allows for the emergence of the soft and subtle emotion of being with oneself, being accompanied by oneself, to wish oneself well, to be oneself, in oneself.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING ONE'S OWN BODY
Introduction: Because of the taboo associated with contact and pleasure that characterizes our culture and, therefore, our education, the connection to our own body is often related to situations of "solitary pleasure": masturbation and, consequently, guilt. Because people have denied their connection to their bodies they do not feel their body as loved. The body has value only if others like it, as if the pleasure comes from others, from the evidence of the compliments of others. But it is a futile quest to always hope to match what we assume will appeal to others. It is important to experience the intimate relationship to our own body in a natural, affective and innocent way. This is a real process of rehabilitation not only of self-esteem, but also of self-image. The love that we can give to ourselves then results in actions, in existential choices that reflect this love.
According to the song used, the vivencia can be more oriented toward self-eroticism or toward transcendence, but should always come from an affective matrix.
Description: The person is standing and her eyes are closed. The hands are placed on the chest and abdomen. When the music starts, the person gently, sensitively and tenderly caresses her entire body, gradually surrendering into a deep vivencia of intimacy in which a complete circuit between the action (the hands that caress) and sensitivity (the body that is caressed) is established. It is a profound act of self-recognition of pleasure.
Objective: The perception of the body with an intrinsic value and as a place and source of pleasure.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING OF HAIR IN PAIRS
Introduction: When someone manages to caress someone's hair with sensitivity and delicacy, it can be said that she has access to the secret of caress and she may, in the future, caress any part of the body with the same sensitivity.
Description: The two people place themselves face to face (sitting or standing). It should be made very clear that this is a situation in which one gives the other receives, alternately. The person receiving the caress closes her eyes to increase responsiveness and sensitivity. The other offers her a superficial caresses of the hair with great gentleness and sensitivity. Superficial means that the fingers do not penetrate inside the hair and do not massage the skull, but they rather aerate the hair, they slide smoothly and lightly.
Objective: To stimulate centripetal sensitivity (from the periphery to the center).

To passively receive caresses means to abandon oneself to receiving centripetal stimulation (from the outside towards the inside) of great intensity. To give these caresses means to be able to exert a pleasant stimulation on a person. When both participants simultaneously perform the exercise, in a reciprocal give-and-receive, there is great complicity in simultaneously giving and receiving. This generates a different type of vivencia because there is more intention, but less specific intensity.

Exercises.Name: COMPRESSION AND DECOMPRESSION OF THE HANDS
Introduction: The perception of pulsation in contact (in touch) is a key element of feedback.
Description: The two people establish a first contact by holding hands and connecting in their eyes. When the music starts, they close their eyes and interact through a pulsating contact of their hands, in perfect feedback and never letting go. To the pulsation of contact corresponds a pulsating movement of the whole body, allowing for moderation of the degree of intimacy and intensity of this dialogue where the contact of the hands gradually involves the entire being.
Objective: To perceive through contact the nuances in the psychotonic dialogue with each other, in all the nuances ranging from the sensitivity of delicate and light touch to the intensity of and very deep and strong contact, until the integration of the pulsation in a dialogue that includes the nuances of the vivencia.

Exercises.Name: GIVING AND RECEIVING CONTAINMENT
Introduction: Generally, in our culture people are not held in the arms, let alone cradled, lulled, rocked. Whether in the family or with friends, most have virtually no opportunities to offer or receive containment in a heart to heart embrace. Some may have such exchanges with people who are very dear and very close, but this happens far too seldom, and the vast majority of people lives through years without living this experiences, without receiving or offering real containment.

To receive containment is a kind of affective nourishment essential for organic self-regulation. According to psychosomatic medicine, many diseases like asthma, allergies, arthritis, insomnia and certain heart conditions, are due to a lack of affective content. And both adults and children are in need.
Description: The two people are sitting so as to face each other and to have their pelvis in contact with each other. In this position, one of the two people snuggles in the arms of the other, who embraces him as it is done when rocking a child. The knees of the person who surrenders are folded so that his body is coiled and wound around the one that rocks; the latter brings the partner against his heart, the head leaning on the crook of his arm on the heart side. The other arm fully embraces in order to give the feeling of containment.
Observation: The facilitator should make sure to clearly indicate the position so that people reach a good fit. This will create favorable conditions for abandonment and the vivencia of being contained. Because many people who do not receive any or just very little containment, many of them reveal a great awkwardness for providing it to others, despite all their good will. Almost as if the archetypal gestures of rocking a child, of hugging, had been forgotten.
Objective: The goal is to learn, to relearn to provide and receive containment. To strengthen the vivencia of our own ability to take care, and the vivencia of surrendering and feeling protected. To stimulate a vivencia of abandonment in confidence and the experience of reparentalization. The situation of alternating reciprocity stimulates in each person the pulsation between the capacity to give and to give oneself, to receive and be received.

Exercises.Name: AFFECTIVE PROTECTION WITH CARESSING OF THE CHEST AND ARMS
Description: The facilitator invites participants to choose each-other to do this exercise in pairs. One sits on the floor and leans his back against the wall, with legs parted for more comfort, and the other also sits, between the legs of the first one, leaning against his chest.

Caresses are affective, and alternating between caresses that go out from the center of the chest, wrap the shoulders and go down along the arms (offering a feeling of openness toward the periphery), and a touch of containment when hands exert a gentle pressure, signifying simple presence.
Observation: It is important to take time to adjust positions so that the head of the person who will be caressed can lean on a shoulder of the one that will provide the caress; and that the caressing person can have access to his shoulders, arms and chest, without being in a posture of tension.
Objective: To give and receive affective containment.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING IN A GROUP OF 3
Description: The participants form small groups of three people. This exercise is to be proposed preferably during the regressive phase of the session of Biodanza, and more preferably so in a group that already has the conditions of vivencial deepening. This is so that the exercise can achieve a deeper level of affective-sexual intensity and intimacy.
The exercise can be done standing or lying down, and depending on the position chosen by the facilitator, will present different vivencial characteristics.
Observation: When it is done standing, one person moves to the center between its two partners, on a stable position with feet parallel, knees slightly bent, eyes closed, and the mouth, neck, shoulders and arms relaxed in a receptive position. The other two partners begin to caress her all over the body very sensitively, with delicate touch and a lot of tenderness. They alternate a consistent quality of touch with shades of lightness or sensitivity. First, a secure touch offered by a gentle pressure on all parts of the body (the movements are soft and tender, without "anatomical" intentionality, and to and sensibilize the entirety of the body. This is the "consistent" or "containing" touch. Then, the second touch has a quality of undifferentiated tenderness by which the caresses generate a sense of dissolution and unification of different body parts. A tenderness that invites the person to melt and accept the gift of "receiving". Both partners then caress the person freely, taking care to "distribute" their touch over the entire surface of the body, including legs, feet and arms, and taking care not to focus both on the same body areas. It is important that the person being caressed has the feeling of being protected and not "fragmented" if certain body parts are "abandoned". Therefore, for example, when one partner is dedicated to the upper body the other takes care of the bottom, and then very fluidly they alternate their positions and caresses.

These caresses can open a very important door to bodily sensations of pleasure and deep eroticism (deep as in integrated with affectivity). These erotic vivencias of sensitive and affective-sexual integration can create the conditions for a renewed state of being at peace with and have a sort of reconciliation with one's body. The experience of one's own body becomes an experience of pleasure and eroticism, which may result in neurophysiological healing responses. We can identify the experience as "the love that heals" in the affective domain as well as in sensuality, sexuality and eroticism.

Consider that in the standing situation the regression will be reduced compared to the lying down situation, which induces a more erotic vivencia for all participants, those offering the caresses and the recipient.

Sometimes the person who is caressed into this level of affective-transcendent surrender has difficulty to stand. In this case, the two companions will help her down to the ground and continue to caress her until the music ends.
This is common in more advanced groups, where undifferentiated eroticism is for some an form of trance and a form of transcendent abandonment for others.
When the exercise is done lying down, the person receiving the caresses lies on the ground between his two partners, who are seated and comfortable.

The person being caressed may change position during the exercise: the facilitator, at a certain moment of the music, will give an indication for the two persons to help her turn. Realized on the ground, the exercise can reach deeper levels of abandonment and intensity. This will require a longer time for changes and activation.
Objective: To allow oneself to surrender and be caressed on the entire body, in order to experience a deep feeling of unity, sensitivity, affectivity and sensuality. Everything that has an integrating effect. The exercise promotes the possibility of an experience of sensual-affective integration.

Exercises.Name: CARESSING IN A GROUP OF 5
Description: This exercise takes place in the same way that the exercise in groups of three.

The abandonment and dissolution facilitated by the group of five sometimes promotes, for some people, an undifferentiated affectivity and a loss of bodily boundaries; for others, it gives access to a level of undifferentiated eroticism and sensuality, a real "undifferentiated Eros".

Exercises.Name: CARESSES (diverse situations of caressing)
Description: Under this section all situations where there may be caresses will be addressed, without this being linked to a specific exercise or for a particular purpose. For example, encounters that follow a compact group and in which music easily induces the exchanging of caresses without this being specified. There will also be, under this heading, music that can be carefully adapted to the context of the group, to the vivencia and the level of deepening, or to other exercises of caresses in the catalog (like the Compact group of caresses, the
Tunnel of caresses, or Caresses in a group of 5).

Exercises.Name: COMPACT SWAYING GROUP
Introduction: In the Compact Group exercises, the individual abandons its identity by conferring it to the group's identity, to become one with it. The identity of one disappears in favor of the identity of the whole.

In the Compact group of swaying, each participant surrenders to rocking himself with his companions, with his eyes closed, and thus returns to an anonymous state, while in a tender and anonymous contact with the others.
Description: The Compact Swaying Group produces a light or medium state of trance with integrative regression. This exercise is the starting point for the induction of deeper trances, such as the trance of abandonment and swaying, in which one of the members of the group is rocked by the others.
The group has a symbolic character of the maternal uterus. Regression to the prenatal state physically and psychologically reorganises and restructures the individual.
A variation of this exercise is the practice of the Choir of the Divine Cane in a Compact Group. In this case the resulting trance can be even more profound.

In order to begin this exercise, one of the participants is asked to serve as the pivot (axis). For this he or she stands in the middle and begins to sway slowly to the music. All participants slowly come closer to this person until they make contact; then the group is asked to sweetly adapt to the movement of this pillar-member. The movement is in slow motion, gentle and harmonious. When the group has acquired cohesion and sways as one, the person in the center also abandons himself to the global movement.
The technique of the Compact Group is subject to the following precepts:
1. The contact is anonymous. The people enter into casual contact with their eyes closed.
2. The swaying creates a state of relaxation, conserving the slow, collective rhythm.
3. Each one collaborates his own movement to the unity and harmony of the swaying.

4. Each one is asked not to restrict the freedom of movement of the other members of the group by imprisoning them with their arms or burdening them with the weight of their body. The more intimate contact of the hands, face or legs must be subject to progressivity, in which each person could allow it or move away.
5. Those who desire less contact can move to the periphery and regulate for themselves the degree of approach.
6. Those who desire greater contact will place themselves toward the center.
7. Consciousness of oneself decreases when all the members of the group sway as one and surrender themselves to a trusting anonymous contact.

Exercises.Name: COMPACT GROUP OF CARESSES
Introduction: The anthropological sense of the Compact Group of Caresses is in close contact with all the rites of primitive religions, such as the orgiastic rites and those of connection to the ancestors (as was the case for the North American Indians of the 16th century).
Description: This is an exercise of anonymous and undifferentiated caress and contact, which allows the vivencia of feeling oneself immersed in the human species, which can be felt as an ocean.
Observation: In the instruction, it is important to indicate to the participants not to stay in one place, establishing contact with a single person, but rather to circulate in the group in order to increase the diversity of contacts.
Awakening the source of desire, the participants improve their own erotic capacity.
When they assume their own sexual identity, beyond all cultural conditioning, people can know themselves better and can direct their sexual choices and behaviour with greater lucidity and awareness.
Objective: - Accepting human diversity
- Discovering ones own sexual identity, beyond gender determination, through contact with different people
- Awakening the source of desire
- Inducing a regressive state
Poetic_element: The Compact Group of Caress is a distant memory of the primitive orgy of celebration of fertility.

Exercises.Name: TUNNEL OF CARESSES
Introduction: Self-esteem and life are strongly linked to eroticism. To live oneself as a space of pleasure, eroticism and tenderness, and to live life as a journey into eroticism and tenderness. Being caressed has profound effects and transforms the expression of human identity: the caress makes us more alive, confident and loving.
Description: The group forms a tunnel and, one at a time, each person walks slowly through it, letting him/herself be caressed by his/her colleagues. When they reach the end of the tunnel they are received by one of them who reintegrates him/her into the tunnel formation in order to caress their companions.
Observation: Each participant crosses the tunnel slowly without interrupting the flow so that the whole group has a chance to enjoy the vivencia of the passage.
Objective: To progress in the experience of undifferentiated erotism. To feel celebrated by the group. To receive tenderness and caresses from everyone. To increase self-esteem through erotism. To relearn to create links through contact and caress, to be receptive to them and to enjoy the pleasure of being caressed. To raise self-esteem by dissolving characterological armours.
Existential_projection: Walking through a tunnel of caresses induces a vivencia of a wonderful world, an experience of paradise here and now and a sense of the sacredness of the body and of the beauty of life.

Exercises.Name: ECOLOGICAL NEST (also called "Nest of the species")
Introduction: Undifferentiated contact, in the situation of the nest, activates the gregarious instinct, the archetype of the clan. This is a very archaic vivencia (the original matrix offering warmth, protection, containment and nourishment can be found in the "primitive cave") and a vivencia of great closeness (friends, relaxing moments of childhood, the closeness of the body of playmates, etc.).
Description: People are invited to lie down together, close to one another in affective contact, with eyes closed, and abandon themselves together in the warmth and protection of the group.
Observation: According to a gradual evolution, and depending on the capacity for intimacy and abandonment in the group, the nest can be offered with variations:
1. From the standing circle, all participants turn towards their right and then lie down on their left side with their and head to the center, as in a "spooning" position.

2. The nest is gradually created by inviting one first person to lie down and then the others to position themselves so that everyone is in contact (receiving or offering the contact with his body: shoulders, arms, stomach as support for others). Those needing more distance or seeking less proximity take care to place themselves towards the periphery.
3. The nest is created spontaneously when people, from a standing position but already in a vivencia of surrender, slowly drop to the ground and snuggle against each other.
The music sets the tone for the vivencia of the nest (affectivity, sexuality, transcendence).
Objective: To stimulate the gregarious instinct, the connection to the group, to the clan and the species, in a state of surrender and relaxation.

Exercises.Name: COMPACT TRANCE GROUP
Introduction: The pulsation of identity between a state of intensified consciousness of self and the state of regression is one of the most important transformational tools in Biodanza. The vivencia of the expansion of consciousness is the desired effect after the return from a trance state.
Description: The whole group comes together progressively through contact and slow and repetitive movements, entering into a heightened state of trance which increases the regression and leads to a fusion with the whole.
Observation: It is important to tell people that they shouldnt shift their full weight onto the other participants. The whole group progressively gives itself to the process and gently lies down on the floor. It may be that some people fall into the trance more quickly than others.
Objective: To heighten the state of trance and enable the vivencia of a progressive decrease in consciousness of the self and a consequent entry into a state of regression, until a state of fusion with the group and with the whole is reached.
Poetic_element: This exercise enables a revival of unity with the whole and a connection with the nostalgia of the lost paradise.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF TRANCE
Description: The person closes his eyes and lets himself be totally danced by the music, in total availability and letting go of any control of his movements, of their form or appearance. In the case of rhythmic music, it is convenient to invite people to begin to move from the inside: releasing the neck, the knees, the jaw, avoiding peripheral movements and allowing the whole body to receive the impulsions coming from the cenesthetic visceral mobilization. The act of shaking the body or shaking the head in a state of tension does not induce an integrative trance. What induces the integrative trance is the gradual dissolution of control through the pleasure of being danced by the music.
Definition: As for the Radicalization of the musical vivencia (Musical Mediumnity), in order to reach the trance state that will allow the dancer to "become the dance", he will need to begin from a state of near-immobility, a state of tonicity which is open to spontaneous proprioceptive impulses. An unconditional and receptive state, free of any project. Under such conditions, the ego disappears and the individual "allows" the music to grow across his body and induce a cenesthetic state.
Being the dance is an experience of transcendence: the human biosystem comes into harmony with the cosmic biosystem. This is the most powerful source of organic renewal and energization.

Exercises.Name: RADICALIZATION OF THE MUSICAL VIVENCIA (Musical mediumnity)
Introduction: Throughout the history of dance, which was most predominant was the will to train good dancers who would be capable of achieving, through learning and practice, an optimization of the mastering, controlling, and beauty of movement.

There is a completely opposite alternative which is a transformation of the dancer into dance. This pathway was discovered occasionally at ceremonies from archaic religions, in some mystical or ecstatic dances, and in some states induced by the absorption of lysergic acid (LSD), mescaline or psilocybin. In these states, the music is superfluous because the tonicity and harmony of the biosystem come into immediate connection with the cosmic harmony. In these cases, the individual does not dance a determined music by translating sounds into movements, but he enters a vivencial state in which he is himself the music.

It is music that dances the dancer. There is no more individual or music. There is only the dance. The identity dissolves into a kind of matrix of the universe, in a full organic movement in which each element is part of a larger dance. The cosmic dance is a set of interactions between all living forces.
Being the dance is an experience of transcendence: the human biosystem comes into harmony with the cosmic biosystem. This is the most powerful source of organic renewal and energization.
Description: To reach the trance state that will allow the dancer to achieve "being the dance," he will need to begin from near-immobility, in a tonus state that is open to spontaneous proprioceptive impulses. An unconditional and receptive state, free of any project. Under such conditions, the ego disappears and the individual "permits" the music to become one with his whole body and induce a coenesthetic state.

Listen to music with the whole body and start dancing from deep visceral sensations, which awake, intensify and deepen the surrender until complete fusion with the music. Being the music, be danced by the dance.
Objective: To reach a higher level of integration between music and movement until you reach the highest state of musical mediumness.
Poetic_element: This dance enables you to constellate the archetype of Orpheus and to activate the transforming forces of music.
Definition: This is a dance that invites you into a cenesthetic surrender to the music with movements directed by the vivencia, in a progressive fusion with the sounds until you become music, allowing the dance to dance within you: to become a medium of the transformative power of music.

Exercises.Name: REGRESSION TO THE STATE OF INFANCY BY CARESSING OF THE FACE
Introduction: According to Rof Carballo, the "primal connection" is the neurological process of integration that is created in the child in his relationship with the containment that it received from its mother. A weak structuring of the "primal link" can have consequences in the development of identity.

The person who experiences the vivencia of regression to a child state in a context of deep affectivity, reissues the perinatal situation in both the psychological and neurological levels. In this way, a compensation process of any forms of affective deficits of infantile origin is generated, which may favor a new affective balance. This process of affective compensation is called the experience of "reparentalization."

In the exercise of Regression to a state of infancy by caressing of the face, the person caressing symbolically assumes the role of father when he is a man, or the role of the mother when she is a woman.
The person that is caressed symbolically assumes the role of the newborn.
Description: The facilitator invites participants to choose each-other to do this exercise in pairs. One sits on the floor and leans his back against the wall, with legs parted, and the other lies down, resting her head on the lap of her partner (on the upper thigh near the groin). He who sits gently caresses the other's face, and the one who is caressed surrenders, eyes closed, into a regressive state.
Observation: it is only about caresses and not about massages or activation of energy points. It is better not to caress the eyes or the mouth, in order to avoid stimulating the state of vigilance, which prevents the regression.

This vivencia may open the way for intense affective manifestations. It is important to invite the people who are invested with the "parental" role to be very attentive during all stages of the exercise, also in the quality of their touch and the posture which must be clearly affective and protective. When the "child" opens his eyes, their eyes must be immediately available. It is often during this first contact, this first "footprint", that the experience of reparentalization happens: the possibility of an immediate connection to life and to affection in the eyes of the one who has accompanied, protected and caressed.
Objective: To induce a state of regression and a vivencia of "reparentalization".
Reparenting: Many people have suffered from stress in early infancy and/or from maternal or paternal abandonment, and therefore do not fully establish the primal link.

Exercises.Name: YANG DANCE
Introduction: The Yin Dance and the Yang Dance are complementary and it is better to propose them successively, in the same class. It is necessary to first propose the Yang Dance, which stimulates the sympathetic-adrenergic system and then to propose the Yin Dance, which stimulates the parasympathetic-cholinergic system. This is the most organic sequence.
The concepts of "yin" and "yang" belong to Taoist philosophy, in which "yin" and "yang" are the two forces of nature that complement each other, forming the Tao, the "Supreme Unity."
According to this philosophy, the yin" principle is the feminine, passive, cold, hidden and receptive and the "yang" principle is the masculine, active, hot, luminous and creative.

In Biodanza the yin and yang concepts are utilised solely as a metaphor designating the great creative forces of the universe, not to impart the Taoist philosophical concept in its totality. Rolando does not share this Taoist philosophical concept in its entirety.
The following meanings are attributed to the "yin": the feminine; receptivity; gestation; the lunar, cyclical, organic aspect; sensitivity and inspiration.
The following meanings are attributed to the "yang": the masculine, the penetrating, the fecundating, the solar aspect, the capacity for fighting, doing and constructing.
We encounter the feminine and masculine archetypes in all cultures, with small variations. (This further corresponds to the first two cards of the Tarot: The Magician and The Priestess.)
In the I Ching the "yin" corresponds to Exagram 1, The Receptive, and the "yang" corresponds to Exagram 2, The Creative.

The great majority of people in our civilisation have a yang behaviour, derived from struggle and from competition in the work environment. This observation demonstrates that an excessively yang lifestyle is stressful, and furthermore an excess of "yang" diminishes personal fascination and the capacity to express eroticism with delicacy.
YANG DANCE

The Yang Dance is characterised by attributes associated with the masculine. If the Yin Dance stimulates creative inspiration, the Yang Dance stimulates the capacity of realisation. Inspiration, which is of "yin" origin, consists of a primordial impulse that can animate a work of art, a project, a dream. The "yang" force, on the other hand, allows one to turn the dream into a reality, beginning from the primordial "yin" impulse, and to complete a work of art that exists solely as a project.
Description: The Yang Dance is dynamic and done through increased muscle tone and the intentionality that is expressed in the movement. The Yang Dance is not only an expression of force, velocity and potency, but also an expression of an inner instinctive and emotive impulse, full of vitality.
This dance is free in that all participants are invited to express their "yang" energy in their own personal style.
The Yang Dance is always done by moving forward and with the eyes open.
Objective: To increase the capacity of realizing goals, of courage, security and confidence in oneself. Therefore the
Yang Dance is specially indicated for people who have difficulty facing obstacles and expressing their own identity.

Exercises.Name: YANG DANCE WITH VOCAL EXPRESSION
Introduction: The Yang Dance with vocal expression (shout, call, scream) is done individually but within the group.

Participants perform arm movements that express strength and vigor: yang gestures. Gradually, they integrate the movement of the whole body with the possibility of moving forward. In doing so, they let out their voices, with vigorous shouts. It is important that the shout is as natural as possible, sprung from the deep within oneself, and is entirely non-theatrical.
Observation: Minotaur Project : Radicalization of the vivencia.
Objective: To heighten the full expression of the yang strength is very important since it is repressed in many people.
Deprived of this force, people feel that their identity is under constant threat.

Exercises.Name: YIN DANCE
Introduction: The Yin Dance is characterised by attributes associated with the feminine: receptivity, sensitivity, capacity for gestation, centripetal tension and intimacy.
Description: This dance, therefore, takes place with very slow and sensitive movements, without displacement, closing the eyes when increasing the intensity of the vivencia. The Yin Dance induces a vivencia of deep receptivity to the musical stimulus.
Objective: To develop the "yin" aspect of behaviour, inducing deceleration and a better sensitivity to life. The Yin Dance induces a state of profound harmony and reduces anxiety and restlessness.

Exercises.Name: YIN-YANG DANCE (Dance of Yin-Yang Integration)
Introduction: The Yin Dance and the Yang Dance can be proposed separately, in which case they have two different functions: they are of didactic value for everyone, and of therapeutic value for people who have difficulty expressing one or the other of the two polarities.

During the Dance of Yin-Yang Integration, the yin and the yang aspects are emphasised successively, and this alternance and the transition from one to the other is done following the coherence of the music. In this way the dance highlights the nuances and variations in intensity of each person's individual creativity.
Description: While during the "yang" phase of the Dance of Yin-Yang Integration the participants eyes are open, they can be closed when dancing the "yin" phase. The transition between the Yin and Yang polarities must be clear and yet in a continuous transition, without breaking the dance.
Objective: This dance of integration stimulates the creative capacity that is present in both men and women. It is important to understand that the "yang" force and the "yin" force exist in all human beings, in different proportions, independent of gender and sexual identity.
CIMEBNote: Objective : To integrate the left and right hemispheres. Voluntary and sensitive motor skills. "Tonic" and "sensitive" tone.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE SERPENT
Introduction: The serpent is associated with the symbolism of the earth and the motor archetype it represents is harmony.

The snake dance must be, unequivocally, a dance of harmony of the whole body. It must also express voracity and the power to fascinate. It can be associated with the act of seduction and conquest of the loved "prey". It has something to do with a certain aspect of love, for he who loves wants to "devour" the beloved.

Other symbols associated with the snake are sacredness and power. The snake is present on the front of the pharaohs' crowns as a symbol of sacred power. The serpent is also part of the caduceus, the symbol of medicine, representing the power of knowledge and healing. The representation of the serpent biting its tail is a very famous image, which indicates that the end is also the beginning, symbolizing the cycles of a process that repeats itself.
Description: The serpent's dance is harmonious. The person begins on the ground with undulating movements, raising himself slowly, raising his head and chest with attitudes of seduction. Some of the snake's expressive ways are hissing and showing the tongue to express the desire to eat.
Objective: Express your capacity for seduction and fascination. Raise your own magnetism.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE TIGER
Introduction: The Dance of the Tiger has some characteristics of this animal: the harmony of the feline, the power of movement, and agility. This dance should not be confused with violent aggressiveness towards a partner. In fact, the tiger is only aggressive when it needs to capture prey for food. During this dance, the person must elevate the muscular tonicity so as to express a tension in the arms, which comes from the shoulders and the back. The energy concentrated in the back goes to the arms and hands, giving a feeling of tension and of inner strength.
Objective: This exercise aims to increase agility, dynamic harmony, and sharpness of movements.

At the very beginning of Biodanza, we used to say that we were "making the tiger come out" whenever it was necessary to respond to aggression. We have eliminated this concept because aggression was indeed imposing itself in the dances of many participants, at the expense of other characteristics of the tiger such as the attractiveness of its natural beauty, its strength, synergy and the elegance of its movements. The symbolism of the tiger is fire.
CIMEBNote: These are slow movements with agile control of power and sinuosity in dynamic balance. The movement is animated by a tension that expresses the intention (to capture, to hunt).

This tension emanates from the shoulders and the upper back (dorsal triangle). The energy concentrated in the back is directed towards the arms and hands, giving a sensation of inner tension. The eyes convey sharpness and quiet determination. The movements are marked by elegance.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE HIPPOPOTAMUS
Introduction: R. Toro: I chose the Hippopotamus as a symbol of water for the participant to better succeed in connecting to the pleasure of wallowing in water and mud. The hippopotamus is also considered a social and ecological animal, in the sense that birds come to feed on the parasites of his skin and he is very sociable with others.

However, it also represents voraciousness by his way of eating, since it consumes nearly one hundred kilograms of grass per day. This vegetarian diet does not diminish its aggressiveness as it remains capable of great fury against a threat, and its power of destruction is terrible. It can be very gentle but also very violent, depending on the circumstances.

Some people think that the symbol of water should be the fish; but for the purposes of Biodanza, the hippopotamus is more appropriate. The fish does not represent so obviously as the hippopotamus the pleasure of wading in the water, wallowing in the mud and being in a near ecstasy state for hours. In addition, fish are cold blooded and move either alone or in a shoal, while the hippopotamus is warm blooded and always lives in herds.
Description: The dynamic of the dance is centered on the belly. The participant begins stroking his own belly and then continues stroking the belly of his companions with slow and fraternal movements.
Objective: Awakens the satiety instinct. Vivencia is associated with visceral pleasure, with eating, and with relieving guilt about sensual pleasures (sensuality).

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE HERON (also called Dance of the Crane)
Introduction: The Dance of the Heron represents grace of movement, lightness, power of ascension and harmony. The dancer's movements start from the center of the chest. The flight is nourished by the energy of the chest, it is an act of opening towards space. The Heron has the grace of flight and the mastery of spaces. The vivencia is one of lightness, absence of gravity, slow ascent and elevation. It also represents the vision from above.

In psychology, there was much talk about deep or abyssal vision, often neglecting the vision from the heights. But we need to get used to looking at things from above, from where difficulties reveal a less threatening aspect and hence it is possible to see the situation in its entirety. This is what is often translated by "stepping back".
The symbolism of the heron is air.
Objective: To incorporate the vivencia of lightness and freedom, in order to compensate for a reality so often narrow, a perception so often limited. The bird is the symbol of freedom to come and go, in a space that nothing restricts.
Existential_projection: The dance of the bird connects us to the archetype of lightness: that which is born of the vision of heights, of flight, of the perception of an open horizon, of the infinite.
CIMEBNote: The feet are apart from the pelvis (one foot is slightly behind the other and in an open position). The knees are supple to allow a pulsating movement of rising and falling (the upward momentum comes from the possibility of descending and taking flight). The arms evoke a smooth, light movement of lift and wings. It is essential that the movement comes from the plexus and not from the shoulders. The eyes are closed.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF TRANSFORMATIONS AND THE MYTH OF SHIVA
Exercises.Category: DANCES OF SHIVA, BRAHMA AND VISHNU
Introduction: Shiva belongs to the trinity of Hindu gods integrated by Brahma, the creator, and Vishnu, the conserver of life. Shiva symbolises the eternal transformation of the universe, which consists of cyclical destruction and creation. He is the god of the dance and of transformation.

The cosmic process is death and resurrection, eternal renewal of life. Within ourselves, the action of Shiva will be to die to our old body and be reborn to a new cycle of life. The dance of Shiva has as its theme cosmic activity, the eternal transformation.
Ananda Coomaraswamy describes the five divine activities of Shiva:
1. The continual creation of the Universe, originated in rhythm.
2. Conservation, based in balance and moderation of movements.
3. Destruction of the forms that have been overcome, through the inner fire.
4. The eternal renewal.
5. The incarnation of life.
The God of the Dance, Shiva Nataraja, is at the same time the God of Changes, which implies that changes are induced by dance.

Shiva is represented with his right foot crushing a demon, which symbolises victory over the demonic fires of destruction, and his left foot in the air, representing balance and the impulse toward ascension. The image of Shiva has four arms, with which he achieves the cyclical creation and destruction of the world. A circle of fire surrounds him. The Dance of Shiva is, therefore, a movement that destroys in order to generate the process of creation.

Inspired by the Dances of Shiva and their symbolism of transformation, Rolando Toro Araneda created the Dance of Transformation, which has three essential attributes of movement: unity, balance and harmony.

Unity: means that the entire body moves in perfect coordination, integrating its parts and connecting with all that lives. From the psychomotor point of view, this requires an integration of pyramidal and extra-pyramidal pathways.

Balance: raises the demand of movement in relation with the earths force of gravity, readjusting postural structure in every moment. All the variations take place in unstable balance on one leg, which requires the integration of the receptors of balance of the inner ear with the cortical-cerebral structures.
Harmony: means that the movements should be made in perfect fusion with the music, giving the body the pulsation of life.

In the learning stage, this integrates the sensory-motor, auditory, visual and vestibular structures. In more advanced stages, this produces amplified states of consciousness, due to the intense process of integration that is induced.
Once the archetypal pattern is established, the Dance of Transformation proposed in Biodanza includes displacement through space, with great richness of variations, creativity and harmony.

The symbolism of the Dance of Transformation suggests the destruction of the old rigid and repressed body, in order to reconcile in a new body, tender and free. One cannot have change if there is no destruction or transformation of the past.

The value of the three absolutes of movement (unity, balance and harmony) is not only in terms of motor integration. There is a process of transcendence in this dance that integrates highly differentiated levels, which has a metaphysical-existential resonance:
Unity: The entire body is in action. No dissociation is possible. The vital energy flows, reinforcing the dynamic stability of the organism.

Balance: This is not only a labyrinth-cerebellum function, but is also psychic: equilibrium before distinct options or temptations of change. There are always possible changes of place, of work, of love, etc. Within these magnetic polarities, each one must be connected with his or her center. This quality of existential balance emerges from the resonance within a center of inner balance.

Harmony: This is the perfect relationship in feedback. Harmony is the connection of stimulus-response to all of the outer world in such a way that the inner world palpitates in resonance, until the barrier between the outer and the inner disappears.

If we embody these three essential characteristics, we initiate a new stage of existential renewal. When carried out with great training, this dance activates not only the cortical, motor and sensory areas and pathways, but also the limbic centers related to cosmic consciousness.
Objective: This dance is performed in different phases. In the learning phase, the sensory-motor, auditory, visual and vestibular (inner ear) structures are integrated. In the more advanced phases, there may be a widening of the state of consciousness, precisely as a consequence of the intense integration process induced.
CIMEBNote: This dance can be performed in pairs (holding hands, face to face) or in the round. In this case, it is more fun.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF BRAHMA
Exercises.Category: DANCES OF SHIVA, BRAHMA AND VISHNU
Introduction: God of Creation, Brahma is the first creator and the creator of all things. He is frequently represented with four arms and four heads, which symbolises omnipresence and omniscience.
The Story:

Brahma receives the gift of creation from the Unspeakable and keeps it in his heart. Then Brahma goes to sleep and dreams, and his dream is the world. His dream is so beautiful that, when he awakens, he decides to create the world that he dreamed. So he creates everything toward the four cardinal directions, giving the gift received. Finally, satisfied with his work, he contemplates his work and offers it to Krishna (or Vishnu, god of conservation of the world). Trusting that his creation is safe, happy to have made the offering, he goes back to his dream.
Description: The person is standing, in the position of identity. When the music begins, both hands are extended outward, in a gesture of receiving the gift of creation and then brought together to the chest, in an act of guarding the gift in the heart. The eyes are closed and the head is abandoned forward, in an attitude of repose.
Little by little, the eyes open, the head raises and rotates slowly from side to side. The person covers all the surrounding space with his eyes.

Then, the right hand and arm open forward and to the same side, with a circular and amplified movement, in a gesture of exercising the gift of creation, while the eyes accompany the gesture. The hand returns to the chest.
The person continues with the opening of the left hand and arm toward the same side. The eyes always accompany the movement. The left hand returns to the chest.
Successively, the gesture is amplified toward reaching the space behind: first by the right arm, then by the left. The eyes always embrace a more amplified, infinite space.
Return to the initial position.

The right leg moves forward with the knee slightly bent; the right arm and hand, palm upward, rise in a gesture of offering. The left hand lightly accompanies below. The eyes make their way upward, and then
Brahma offers his creation to Krishna. Observe that, while the entire body tends forward and upward, the right knee bending disposes one toward an attitude of respect and humility.
Return slowly to the initial position; the legs together, the hands on the chest, the head lightly resting downward and the eyes closed.
Objective: - To value ones own creative capacity.
- To have the vivencia of generosity; to create is to offer ones own fruits to the universe, to life.
- To have an amplified consciousness of oneself as creator, as centre of the creation.
CIMEBNote: Definition : Invocation of the creative force in its generous and organised aspect - Cosmos (in comparison with the destructive aspect of Shiva - Chaos).
DanceStages: 1 Position of identity
Receiving of the gift of creation
2 Position of intimacy
Brahma resting and dreaming
3 Awakening and discovering with the eyes the surrounding space
Brahma awakens and notices that the dream world does not exist
4 Gestures of offering toward the left and right
Brahma decides to create all the things he dreamt (the gesture evokes sowing generously from what is in our heart)
5 Gestures of wider opening towards the space behind
They include the space behind the back
6 Return to the position of identity and contemplation
Brahma is satisfied and contemplates his creation
7 Gesture of offering toward the right and above with both hands
Brahma offers his creation to Krishna with generosity and trust
8 Position of intimacy
Upon finishing his work, Brahma rests

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF CONSERVATION AND THE MYTH OF VISHNU
Exercises.Category: DANCES OF SHIVA, BRAHMA AND VISHNU
Introduction: Vishnu is the god of the conservation of vital cycles. He represents the source of biological inertia that repeats and conserves life in the universe (regularity and homeostasis). He is the beauty of permanence, that which generates security and confidence. Every day, at dawn, the same sun always appears to give life; every night the moon appears in the darkness; the same sequence of the seasons; the notable stability of the stars in the heavenly vault; our loved ones staying with us; the happiness of always seeing the same loved face. In this regularity, variations happen in harmony, within the same patterns.
Vishnu establishes the axis within the system and gives balance to our body on both legs.
Based in the symbolism of Vishnu, Rolando Toro Araneda and Cecilia Luzzi created the Dance of the Conservation of Life.

Just as we take an evolutive jump (transtasis), we must change the forms of balance and conserve the new balance achieved, which requires the homeostasis of Vishnu. The ergotropic functions of rest and renewal need the energy of Vishnu. To protect what we love and what is at the heart of our existence, we need the force of Vishnu.
The Dance of Conservation is carefully structured to induce that state of serene harmony.
Objective: The Dance of Conservation induces the profound need to move within patterns of stability, with reference to an affective centre full of containment.
