It represents the care of the intimate warmth of life and of the home, keeping this fire within us, staying within the ecstasy of everyday life, connected with the earth and rejecting change, giving life the solemnity required to form a home of growth and maturity.
DanceStages: 1 Search for the centre
With the feet planted on the floor, oscillating with light movements, both side-to-side and back-to-front, until finding our centre and obtaining a feeling of stability.
2 Symmetric variations
Symmetric variations of the arms turning from the central axis of the body, without displacement.
3 Asymmetric variations
Asymmetric variations of the arms turning around the central axis of the body, without displacement.
4 Posture of Vishnu

Standing, leaning on the left hip and leg (bending the right knee), with the left hand on the hip, in a position of stability without rigidity. The right hand is raised to the height of the chest, with the palm facing outward, in a delicate gesture of stopping external elements or change.
5 Rejecting changes
The right hand advances in a gentle gesture of rejection. It is a movement done with decision and satisfaction.
6 Symmetric dance with amplified
Symmetric dance with amplified, equal movements of the arms.
7 Asymmetric dance with amplified movements
Asymmetric dance with amplified movements of the arms: testing the stability with major changes, but always conserving the inner axis.
8 Caring for the fire
Forming an invisible sphere with the hands, maintained by the natural magnetism of the body, moving from left to right.
9 Guarding the fire
Raising the sphere toward the chest, in a gesture of intimacy. The affective values are conserved within the chest.
10 Circle of protection
The arms gently fall toward the centre and, lifted from the sides, generate a circle that closes over the head.
Here our own world is protected and rescued.
11 Posture of Vishnu
See number 4

Exercises.Name: RHYTMIC CHORUS
Introduction: The "Rhythmic Chorus" is realized by presenting two different mantras: the first is "Samba Cananda Camina
Bum Ba" and the second, "Ace Cita Hum". This is an exercise in the line of transcendence.
Description: Participants are placed in a circle, holding hands and with eyes closed. They chant one of the mantras while marking the rhythm with their feet pounding the ground. Throughout this rhythmic repetition, the facilitator makes sure that no one gets dispersed in such personal initiatives that would make him differentiate themselves from others. For this, all participants are encouraged to sing and chant the mantra as one single voice, blending in with the group's identity.

Exercises.Name: CHORUS OF CAA DIVINA (divine bamboo)
Description: The group in a circle rehearses the emission of voice from the organs and not from the throat. Then the participants begin to softly emit the sound of the letter A, together with the exhale. This creates a monophonic sound that slowly comes from the polyphonic sound of the variations of tone of the group.

The participants keep their eyes closed, in a state of corporal relaxation. You have to ask the group to stay in harmony, avoiding the possible tendency for one person to raise his voice above the rest.
Observation: It may happen that a participant falls on the floor due to the intensified state of trance. In this case, gently take the person out of the circle and get a companion to give containment.
Objective: Induction of the state of trance and regression to the undifferentiated, within a mystical context. The undifferentiated refers to the decrease of the perception of your own corporal limits. The mystic context alludes to the feeling of fusion with the universe.
Poetic_element: This exercise is inspired by Tibetan ceremonies. The metaphor divine cane refers to the bamboo canes that sing in the wind. It is not the canes that sing, but rather Something which sings within them. This is how we explain the lack of intentionality in the emission of the voices. For the Tibetans this Something is divinity. In Biodanza it is only a metaphor for cosmic harmony.
CIMEBNote: This exercise achieves its goal even more when people have acquired the ability to merge with the group, when the need to differentiate themselves disappears.

Exercises.Name: CHORUS OF CAA DIVINA IN A SPIRAL
Description: Another way is to sing the letter "a" in a circle, in which two participants let go their hands, and one of them starts to turn very slowly onto himself, on the side where he is still holding the hand of a companion, which has the effect of producing a winding of the whole group into a spiral. A compact group is finally formed and people stop moving in order to stay in this "winding". The formation of this spiral tends to accentuate the trance effect induced by this exercise. We must therefore ensure that the person who will be at the heart of this spiral is completely ready to surrender.
The exercise is performed without music.

Exercises.Name: CHORUS OF CAA DIVINA WITH EMERGENCE
Description: Participants in the circle emit the sound of the letter "a", seeking to harmonize their volume without anyone dominating the others with his own voice. The sound must be very deep, visceral and not come from the throat. When people are harmonized, one of them may enter the circle, eyes closed, and let his chanting emerge while the others maintain the constant basis. When this person feels she has finished, she remains a moment in silence and joins the circle again, and is replaced by another person in the center.
This exercise requires good affective preparation of the group so that none of the participants monopolizes the center.

Exercises.Name: SINGING ONE'S OWN NAME
Description: Participants form a circle and one person voluntarily moves to the center, in a posture of deep connection to self. She begins to sing her own name from the emotion generated by the gift she is giving to he, seeking to listen to the inner resonance of the word/name that represents her identity.
Observation: This exercise is a challenge of the Minotaur Project. When it is proposed outside of this context, the facilitator must reserve this exercise to very special circumstances (for example a birthday) and create an atmosphere of ritual, so that the vivencia of singing one's own name does not turn into something superficial or trivial.
Objective: This is an exercise of reinforcing identity, which can induce vivencia of intasis (state of heightened awareness of self in which the person perceives to be the bearer of all the possibilities of life).
Poetic_element: The sonorities of each name are unique when they vibrate in the voice of the person wearing it.
Remark: This exercise is done without music.
Existential_projection: To sing one's own name is a vivencia of deep connection to oneself: to give the name by which we are called the echo of the call that we offer ourselves. And recognize ourselves in this call.

Exercises.Name: SINGING THE NAME OF A COMPANION
Description: Participants are placed in a circle and holding hands. The distance between them should allow them to have the arms relaxed along the body and being in contact with each other by the shoulders. A person voluntarily moves to the center of the circle and turns in the direction of a companion of his choice to sing him his name. To realize this song, this person is invited to enter into deep connection with herself, in a position that stimulates introspection (intimacy). Thus, eyes closed, she begins to sing a melody to fit the name of the chosen companion. When the variations of the melody so request, the person plays with the vowels, extending the modulation to create a seamless integration between his chanting and the name sung. Once the singing is completed, the two people embrace and return to the circle where so as to leave the center empty for another volunteer.
This exercise is part of the line of Affectivity.
Observation: It is done without music.
Objective: On one hand, strengthen the affective expression of the identity in the person who, by his song, expresses an impulse towards the other (courage to show signs of affection).
On the other hand, reinforce the identity of the person receiving the gift of the song of his name from someone in his group (valuation of self-esteem in receiving the affective gift).
CIMEBNote: This exercise is a real affective confirmation ceremony. It can be used as part of a sequence to celebrate a particular person on a special occasion (challenge, minotaur, special moment in the life of the group, etc.).

This exercise can also be done in a circle: one person goes to the centre and sings - calls out - the name of a companion. The person being called comes to the centre and gently approaches the first person. He or she then calls out another name, and the first person joins in. And so on, until the whole group has been called. The facilitator stays outside to keep the last callers in check.
And...also:

The group is placed in a round and a volunteer is invited to go to the centre to sing the first name of a companion. The participants all join in chorus to the melody. The exercise is performed without music.

Exercises.Name: DIALOGUE OF VOICES
Introduction: This is an exercise in the line of affectivity. It is realized in pairs. It sensibilizes participants to the ability to enter in resonance with each other, in the absence of any discourse. This is truly a sound dialogue, with voice and without words.

It is characterized by the search for a sensitive connection with each other by the echo of the voice. It induces a vivencia of deep affective communion, because the two people very subtly transmit by their voice their moods and emotions.
Description: The two persons are placed at a distance and remain with closed eyes in an attitude at once receptive and connected with themselves. Each one emits, in turn, a sound that may have the structure of a short melodic phrase. The other must then respond to this "call" in complete coherence by tuning in, by putting himself in tune with what the partner said with his voice, and not based on a response from the ego. It is about connecting by the voice and not about differentiating themselves from each other. It is this search for coherence and harmony with the call that generates the vivencia of resonance. The answer is also in the form of a short melodic phrase, in the same tone, in the same shade.

Throughout this dialogue, each of the two slowly and sensibly move towards the voice of the partner. When the two persons are very close to each other they can exchange an embrace, gently blending their voices for a few moments, and then the exercice ends.
The exercise is performed without music.

Exercises.Name: POEM - SONG
Introduction: The composition of a poem is first proposed, through the exercice belonging to the line of creativity called "My poem is you."

Having written the poem, each person tries to put music to his words, taking only a few verses that are repeated and modulated on the melody (for example, certain vowels are stretched, others chanted, to adjust the lyrics to the melody).

For the musical framework, people retain a theme on which they will make variations. These must be related to the basic theme and thus define the melody; therefore, changes that are beyond the subject and in which each phrase is different should be avoided. No background music should accompany this exercise.
Remark: This exercise is more precisely part of deepening vivencias of Biodanza Extensions such as "The Laboratory of Creativity", the "Minotaur Project" and "The Tree of Desires".

Exercises.Name: POEM - SONG - DANCE
Introduction: This exercise integrates three different forms of creative expression: poetry, song and dance. Participants are first invited to write a poem by the exercise of the line of creativity called "My poem is you."
The participant then creates a melody that fits his poem: not necessarily to the whole text, but preferably to a sentence full of beauty and meaning.

Finally, in a third stage, the participant dances while singing the poem that he has written himself. It is, of course, necessary to try several times until the perfect integration arises between the three components.
This exercise is performed without music.
Remark: This exercise is more precisely part of deepening vivencias of Biodanza Extensions such as "The Laboratory of Creativity", the "Minotaur Project" and "The Tree of Desires".

Exercises.Name: THE POEM IS YOU
Description: Two people choose each-other based on affinity. They sit facing each other and enter into the contemplation of one another. They open to the mystery of each other, sensitizing themselves to the essence, the mood, the emotions that the face of the other expresses and all the essential that emerges from this contemplation.
Then, while maintaining proximity, each expresses through poetic language their vivencia of seeing the other. You are the poem: you are the center of my perception. You are the reason for my poem.
Objective: To develop affective poetic language and the ability to exalt the presence of the other.
Remark: It is preferably proposed without music, so as not to "influence" the inspiration of people with the emotional semantic content of it. However, it is prepared by a music and also concludes with the same music, which sets the initial frame of connection to intimacy and the final frame of time and ritual.

Exercises.Name: INNER DANCE (without music)
Introduction: The "Inner dance" is done without music, thus giving priority to a deep connection with oneself, to cenesthetic movements induced by deeply listening to oneself.
Description: It is a dance of great intimacy presenting very personal characteristics, both in form and in the vivencia. The movements are very slow and done from a deep listening to oneself. Inner perception and deep connection to one's own intimacy induce, in this sphere of silence, the perception of musicality, of the inner sound. By the reduction of voluntary movements and intentional expressive gestures, cenesthetic movements are accentuated and give birth to an inner dancing.
When this exercise is proposed in nature, the inner response is much greater because it is accentuated by the sensory and sound stimulations coming from the environment itself.

In "Biodanza and Voice," from one's own respiratory flow (our breathing rate), from one's own vital breath, in the silent and sensitive listening of it, one can experience the intense and transcendent vivencia of the "breath of life" in all its sound nuances and possibilities.
Objective: The "Inner dance" requires a good level of sensory-motor integration and fluidity. Its main objective is to deepen self-perception, develop a movement of intimacy with self, and the connection to different sensory and sensitive elements of our perception.

Exercises.Name: SENSIBLE DRAWING
Introduction: The development of our "sensible perception" is the first condition to create images through drawing.

When we wish to draw a face, a landscape, an object, whether real or imaginary, we are generally using the "ocular-motor channel" and putting it at the service of pre-established representations, of patterns stored in our memory as in a computer; we construct the drawing from our own repertoire of learned forms. The result is a rigid design which is lifeless and without soul, a kind of simplistic and obvious pattern. The complexity of the image, which refers to the morphogenesis, is absent.
There is no connection between the group of signs and the intrinsic meaning of the form. This is a dissociation between the semiotic and semantic aspects. It lacks emotion. It lacks life.

If we take as a starting point for morphogenesis our "perception of the object", going at it with sensitivity in its immediate suggestions, whether they be shadows or forms united in space, we manage to discover the sense of the image.
The artist, like the explorer, moves from one territory to another uniting in the same line or the same path the structures that emerge under his eyes, revealing the form in all its complexity.

When we draw the diagram that we have in mind, the design is rigid. If we draw without keeping our eyes glued to the paper, but rather trying to perceive or capture something else of the subject, its forms which are alive, vibrant and expressive, reveal their essence.

The appropriate technique for doing this is the sensible perception of the object, that is to say, not a formal perception. The eyes slightly out of focus, slowly travelling through forms and contours with our gaze, be it a vase, a face, a plant, etc.
Description: The proposition is done in two stages. The exercise is carried out in pairs, the two persons are facing each-other and they draw, without specific instruction from the facilitator and as they would usually draw, the portrait of their partner. Then, leaving aside their design, they essentially impregnate themselves with the face of one another (this part may be preceded by a caressing of the face in pairs). On a new sheet, they then realize the "sensitive portrait" of the companion, trying not to look at their page, but letting instead the stroke express most of their perception.

People will then offer themselves a moment of contemplation of their respective works. Then all the drawings are brought to the center, each placing his formal drawing near their sensitive design, and then the group forms a circle that moves around in order to sensitize themselves through the contemplation on the drawings.
Observation: The same exercise can be done with an object.
DANSES SPECIFIQUES
Under this heading will be grouped dances in connection with extensions or very specific situations.
Sometimes they are variations from the basic dances of the IBF Catalog (Rolando Toro Araneda), and sometimes they are related to the vivencial radicalization.
Extensions or situations of radicalization are, for example:
The Four Elements, The Minotaur Project, Biodanza in Nature, Aquatic Biodanza, The Paths of Ecstasy, The Tree of Desire, Deep Femininity and Masculinity, etc.
Some of these dances are inspired by specific applications such as Biodanza for Children and Adolescents.
Objective: Unlocking our drawing from the limits of formal perception to enable a sensible and essential perception of objects and beings. In creativity, sensible perception is subjective, therefore original and unique.

Exercises.Name: SILENT SYNTONY
Introduction: This is an exercise of great importance because it induces a deep vivencia of receptivity to the stimulations from the environment and especially to human contact. It belongs to the line of Affectivity.
Description: The dance is done in pairs. One of two people closes her eyes and, in a relaxed position, remains passive and in a state of extreme sensitivity. The other is active: he touches lightly and with great delicacy different parts of the partner's body, who responds to these delicate "stimuli" by a substantial movement of the body part that has been touched. And thus gradually emerges a sensitive dance in response to the received stimulations and in harmony with them. For example, if she feels her hand being touched, moves it with the utmost sensitivity.
At the end of the exercise, the person who has been in the receptive vivencial situation receives an embrace from her partner, and then the roles are reversed.
Observation: The person who has the active role is also urged not to overstimulate her partner, that is to say not to touch various parts of the body at once or too quickly, since that would leave no room for a sensitive expression.
Objective: Stimulation of sensitive-motor integration through affectivity. Sensibilization to the stimulations coming from the environment.
Remark: This exercise is done without music. It is nevertheless possible to propose it with music, in which case one should refer to the description of the "Dance of sensibilization in pairs".
GENERATIVE POSTURES
INTRODUCTION
Since the dawn of history to the present, the movement and gesture vocabulary of humanity is impregnated with "postures" and gestures which have an eternal character.

These archetypal gestures are found on the reliefs of churches and other temples, in sculptures, paintings and frescoes across all cultures and all civilizations, and across all times. They are gestures and acts of worship, maternity, reverence, labor or intimacy.
Rudolf von Laban hypothesized that the movements of dance are the movements of life and founded a movement based on this principle.
Etienne Decroux - creator of Dramatic Body Mime - has selected 22 basic positions that are the basis for the gestures of the traditional art of mime.

For Biodanza I selected three codes - or groups - of Generative Postures, of which the different possible combinations give rise to spontaneous dances of great richness and reveal the wealth of human depth.
Each one of these postures contains a deep psychological and symbolic meaning.

The archetypal gestures belong to the collective unconscious as described by Carl G. Jung and are true matrixes of human expressivity. The three codes of Generative Postures that I present in Biodanza are the product of an extensive research conducted around the gestural repertoire of different cultures: Hindu, Egyptian, Greco-Roman, to name just a few. I selected those that seem to represent highly evolved forms - capable of inducing profound and transcendent vivencias - and which have the power to generate "eternal dances."
I have called these archetypal gestures "generative postures" because they have the potential of generating specific dances.
(NDT: in Methodology II, Rolando Toro describes specific dances as being those which permit the expression of genetic potentials)

The usual expressive dance (let's say, common) is a combination of movements organized from the personal emotion of the dancer. The dances that arise from the combination of generative postures have a more universal dimension and hint at the greatness of the human being. The combination of three or more Generative Postures results in dances of extraordinary beauty which are endowed with great expressive force.

The completion of each Generative Posture should last about one minute, following which the facilitator invites the participants to do a free dance, creating their own variations on the archetypal matrix, that is to say, from the Generative Posture itself.

The basic posture of almost all the Generative Postures is the Posture of Identity, from which we begin and to which we return. Legs are separated to the width of our hips, head on shoulders, standing straight, arms relaxed.

The division into three separate Codes also refers to the growing vivencial capacity of the dancer. Indeed, a vivencial immaturity does not allow full access to the objectives of the Generative Postures of Code II or III.
GENERATIVE POSTURES - CODE 1

Exercises.Name: ABDOMINALS (Dance of the astronaut when proposed to children)
Description: This exercise consists on lying down on the floor with only our back in contact with the surface, holding the upper chest, the head and the extremities far from the ground, In this position, slightly balance ourselves by lifting and lowering our upper body (without touching the ground) and slowly moving the legs and the arms as if we were in antigravitational conditions, as an astronaut flowing in space.
Remark: This exercise is specific to the methodology of Biodanza with children. It evokes the sensation of flowing in space without gravity, so the image of the astronaut is suggested to the children in the instruction.

Exercises.Name: BIOGENERATOR (Clinical Biodanza)
Introduction: The Biogenerator is a ceremony inspired by the ancient anthropological rites of healing. This exercise evokes the human being's capacity of healing. Before proposing the Biogenerator, participants should be prepared through exercises of affectivity and transcendence, to stimulate in them a state of love and peacefulness.
The setting is very important: the participants are invited to form two concentric circles, where the persons in the inner circle face outward and those in the outer circle face inward.
Description: The inner circle will be formed by those participants which are in a difficult existential moment in their lives, whether it be sickness, pain, anxiety, preoccupation. These persons can place a hand on the part of their body which is or represents their difficulty. For example, if the person is suffering for a love reason, puts her hand on her chest close to her heart; if it is about professional problems, the hand con be placed on the head; if it is a problem with the genital organs, places the hand on them; etc.
Those in the external circle slowly move to the side and stop briefly in front of each companion in the inner circle, caressing one after the other in their afflicted area of the body.

Those in the external circle should not stay too long with the same person (maximum one minute) in a way as for the circle that regenerates life to be able to move with fluidity without being stopped.

Exercises.Name: CHANT OVER THE BODY (Sound Bath)
Introduction: This is a specific exercise proposed in the context of an approach of healing through neo-shamanism.
Description: In the lying down position, a person receives a "sound bath" issued by the visceral emission of the breath of five (or seven) of his companions over his body. People connect with their ability to give and they transform their affective intention into a visceral voice expression. The voice is a vibration, that vibration carries the actual intent of the people and "bathes" the lying person entirely, who is in a state of abandonment promoting trance and becomes "permeable" and absorbs this vibration. A harmony is slowly created between all, and the perception of the vibration of that harmony has for all a harmonizing effect, to a very deep organic level.
At the end of the ceremony, the person receives a touch of containment over her entire body, and then is received into a seated position, by alternating embraces to increasingly recover her identity.
Objective: To induce a state of trance through the vibration of the voices over the body.

Exercises.Name: CONNECTING TO THE GLORY OF LIVING
Introduction: Challenge of the Minotaur Project.
Description: This dance has the meaning of an ontological celebration: to celebrate the very fact of being alive, and to allow the full manifestation of the deep inner euphoria that comes from the very act of living. Being alive is a great triumph that we must celebrate with intensity.

Exercises.Name: CONNECTION TO ONE'S OWN FORCE
Introduction: The lack of connection to ones own force often causes a feeling of weakness and limits the full expression of the individual. All people have a life force. The vivencia of feeling this life force is part of the rehabilitation of confidence in life and self-esteem.

Yet, force is often associated with aggression or anger. It is important to differentiate this vivencia and return it to a place of value in the process of rehabilitation of a healthy and powerful identity.
Description: Concentration of force: Feeling our force without scattering, with nothing else to do, as the warrior who is preparing all his life, getting ready for when he needs that strength. The movements are intense. Eyes closed. No displacement. No "parasite" useless movements.

Expression of force: This is where the power connected, maintained, will be expressed in an intense yang dance with tonicity. Eyes are open and displacements are rooted, with consistency. The expression of force is passionate, luminous. It is not associated to anger.
Objective: To stimulate the perception of one's own strength through the experience of tonicity, balance, expression and intensity.
Remark: It is interesting to propose the two dances (Concentration and Expression) in a row, one after the other.

Exercises.Name: CUBIST DANCE
Introduction: Laboratory of Creativity.
Description: A dance evoking the Cubism school of contemporary art: angular, asymmetric movements.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE SHAMAN
Introduction: The characteristics of the Shaman are complex and multiple: these include nature and the elements, freedom of time and space, capacity of transformation and transmutation of identity through trance, the experience of death and rebirth, and preserving the psychic identity of the community. The tools of healing are complex and multifaceted and related to the ability to dedifferentiate.
The dance is, for the shaman, the way of knowledge and travel in the different dimensions of life.
Description: The dance is a dive into the here and now, a total forgetfulness of self. However, as any trance, it is encoded by the intended meaning. Here, it is to identify by merging with the elements, with the masks or totem animals.
Observation: The music is created by the use of the drum (either by the dancer himself or by a person in the group mastering the use of the drum). One can also use incantatory music from the Navajo Indians.
Remark: Extension Biodanza and Shamanism.

Exercises.Name: DANCE FROM CHAOS TO HARMONY (chaos to order)
Introduction: In his approach of Creativity (as much artistic as existential), Rolando Toro describes it as the path that goes from chaos to order. In his approach of affectivity, love is the only force capable of letting us transform the darkest situations. In his approach of transcendence, he invites us into intimacy with order at the center of the undifferentiated, of the uncreated, of the unknown of everything which our limited perception is uncapable of seeing but nevertheless exists. Our path of humanity is in our capacity to find order and harmony in every situation, in our capacity to find the courage to become intimate with the Chaos. Courage is, together with love and illumination, an element of the numinous unconscious.
Description: The person dances and lets herself dive into the chaos, the darkness, a dance where her forces disappear, where sadness can appear. She is invited to perceive in the music the moment where chaos is changed and the dance becomes the expression of a transmutation, with an elevation towards light and harmony.
Objective: To get acquainted with our vital forces, which are capable of allowing us to find the principle of attraction which "pulls us out of chaos", towards order and harmony. Order is the force of love.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF OPPRESSION-LIBERATION (Release of Oppression)
Introduction: We are often the greatest oppressor of our life force, our desires, our instincts. This is because of the introjected prohibitions and conditionings coming from our education. The more our education has been rigid, the stronger the inner dictator will be. We need to find in ourselves the strength to free ourselves from the chains that hinder our progression towards our identity.
Description: The person is placed kneeling on the ground, her head toward the ground. The hands are placed behind the back and both wrists are held together forcefully as two handcuffs. The person connects to the power of self-oppression in order to gradually transform it into the force of self-liberation. The moment of release should be a time of jubilation and triumph. The whole length of the music should serve to raise the force of an internal revolt against the oppressor within.
Observation: This dance is specific to the Minotaur Project and constitutes an existential challenge.
Objective: To stimulate the self-liberation force.

Exercises.Name: DANCE FOR AN ABSENT BEING
Introduction: Applied in the Minotaur Project and in groups that are prepared for vivencial radicalization.
Description: The person dances in coherence with the semantic content of the music, evoking someone who is absent (avoiding to evoke a dead person) and symbolically offering his dance to that person.
Objective: The absence of a loved being can be filled by the evocation of its presence. Often telepathic type of phenomena occurs when we strongly evoke the presence of a loved being.

Exercises.Name: SURREALISTIC DANCE
Introduction: Laboratory of Creativity

Exercises.Name: SAYING NO - SETTING LIMITS
Introduction: A challenge in the Minotaur Project.
Description: Standing in the posture of Identity, with eyes open, the person is invited to express a NO to the four cardinal points, done with a firm gesture, in coherence with the tone of his voice and the movement of the whole body.
Objective: Stating with power, determination, serenity and assurance the ability to say no, to oppose oneself and to set limits.

Exercises.Name: EXPRESSION OF FEMINITY
Introduction: Specific approach of gender identity. Profound feminity.
Description: The women dance in deep connection with themselves and following the impulsion from the music, invoking by their dance what is truly feminine: depth, sensuality, tenderness, openness, welcoming, generously giving oneself in order to deepen for themselves the vivencia of feeling as a woman and assuming their greatness. The facilitator will avoid giving a strong demonstration and will invite them into the sincere expression of self and the acceptation of diversity.
Objective: To integrate the expression which is proper to the feminine gender, in a way that is archetypal and not stereotyped.

Exercises.Name: EXPRESSION OF MASCULINITY
Introduction: Specific approach of gender identity. Profound masculinity.
Description: The men dance in deep connection with themselves and following the impulsion from the music, invoking by their dance what is truly masculine: depth, sensuality, vigour, openness, welcoming, generously giving oneself in order to deepen for themselves the vivencia of feeling as a man and assuming their greatness.
The facilitator will avoid giving a strong demonstration and will invite them into the sincere expression of self and the acceptation of diversity.
Objective: To integrate the expression which is proper to the masculine gender, in a way that is archetypal and not stereotyped.

Exercises.Name: COSMIC FOETALIZATION
Introduction: It is a challenge of the Minotaur Project, and an exercise of deepening of the vivencia of transcendence in the extension "Biodanza in Nature". Not to be confused with the Generative Posture of "Floating in amniotic liquid".

Exercises.Name: HOWL LIKE A WOLF
Introduction: Minotaur Project, Biodanza in Nature, and Laboratory of Creativity.

Exercises.Name: MANDALA DANCE
Introduction: Extension "The paths to extasy".

Exercises.Name: OPENING OF VITAL SPACE (Creating the space of our growth)
Introduction: Certain lifestyles and habits reduce existential mobility. Some people do not dare to broaden their horizons, even if they dont feel nurtured by their (affective or professional) environment. Others are content with an acquired or impoverished form of security. They stop evolving and growing. It is the instinct of exploration that should be stimulated: to move, to dare to speak, to become curious, to give a larger space to the expression of our motivations.
Description: This dance is characterized by determined, passionate, and voluntary displacements, coming from our affective center. The movements are large, the eyes take in the surrounding space. The muscle tonus adapts according to the impulses: sometimes light, sometimes powerful. The invoked vivencia is of expansion of vitality, power, willingness, and determination.
Observation: According to the music selected, the dance may be followed by a dance of maximum or harmonic extension, which are also dances of opening the vital space.

Exercises.Name: CUBIST STYLE PAINTING
Introduction: Laboratory of Creativity.

Exercises.Name: IMPRESSIONIST PAINTING
Introduction: Laboratory of creativity.

Exercises.Name: PERCEPTION OF NATURE WITH THE FIVE SENSES
Introduction: This exercise belongs to the extension "Biodanza in Nature".

Exercises.Name: AESTHETIC PERCEPTION OF THE OTHER (Qualifying the other)
Introduction: In general, people have great difficulty perceiving the inner state of those around them and remain mostly at a formal and superficial level of perception of the external aspects. Thus, they fail to capture, to become aware of their mood, their joy, their sorrow, their fears, their sadness, their pain, their anger, their eroticism, their affective world. It goes without saying that with this lack of perception, relations are confined to their most superficial level.

It should be noted that aesthetic is the ability to perceive beauty. In the same manner that there is a aesthetic applied to the field of art (poetry, music, theater, etc..), I propose the concept of Aesthetic
Anthropology, that is to say the perception of the beauty of the human being.
Description: Form groups of six people who will sit in a circle. One participant starts communicating with its neighbor by placing himself in front of him and holding his hands. He expresses with affection his perception of the most beautiful aspects in him, that he discovers and to which he becomes sensitive.
There is no reciprocity. After an embrace, the person who received this honor will do it with its immediate neighbor. When the group has finished, the facilitator proposes a group embrace.

It is important that people in each group follow the indication of "neighborhood", to avoid "choosing" among the six people the one to whom they want to address their appreciation. As there is no reciprocity, there is no differentiation. The proposition is to develop the ability to see that there can be beauty in every person, and not only among those with whom we can have an affinity.
Observation: Without music.
Objective: Learning to perceive the other in all its depth, in its most positive aspects. Increase the capacity of human understanding.

Exercises.Name: PERCEPTION OF THE OTHER WITH THE FIVE SENSES
Introduction: In our perception of others and of ourselves, we are often limited by biases related to the body. Our senses are doors that are open to the world, to the world of the other. Opening the doors of our sensory perception gives us access to the reality of the other.
Description: People form pairs and will realize the entire sequence together (sight, smell, hearing, taste and touch). More than an exercise, this is a real ceremony of discovering the other and, for the person who abandons himself to be "perceived" in all its corporeality, a ceremony of offering oneself to being discovered.
Observation: Music accompanies all stages of the exercise except that of Hearing which takes place in silence to allow the perception of the tiniest sounds. At the end of the ceremony, the person who has offered herself is received in an embrace by her partner before proceeding to the exchange.
Objective: To overcome the taboos related to the body and open our total perception. Moreover, to overcome our inhibitions to being seen in our natural totality, without artifice. This perception of the other with the five senses is an opening on total acceptance and intimacy.
Poetic_element: No aroma, no landscape, no fragrance, no texture, no music could be more beautiful than what creation has put at the heart of our living bodies. They are an expression of life itself. To receive them is to honor them.
DanceStages: 1 Sight

The person dances, facing her companion who is sitting in a receptive position and offering his entire attention. The dancing person is seen in her deployment. It's not a dance of seduction. It is the vivencia of the reality of seeing and being seen.
2 Hearing

The person is now lying on his back and will remain in this receptive position throughout the successive stages. The other puts his ear very close to the body parts that feature natural sounds: the breath, the heart, the guts. Every sound a music of life. Each music is unique.
3 Smell

Go through the companion's body inhaling the odors of its skin and its most expressive parts (armpits, nostrils, corners of lips, hair, neck). No body part is taboo. No odor is taboo. Each person has a unique perfume.
4 Taste

Each skin has a flavor. Delicately go through the skin with our lips and our tongue, in order to perceive the flavors (hands, the fold of the neck, elbows, etc.) with gentleness and voluptuousness. With reverence and veneration.
5 Touch

Allow your hands, with tenderness and deep connection, to perceive what the eyes can never grasp. The contact becomes caress and worship. It should be noted that the contact is not exploratory, but the enchantment of discovery and intimacy.

Exercises.Name: REBIRTH
Introduction: Minotaur Projet.
Description: This is a ritual to confront and transmute the fear of aging and the fear of death.
For the complete instruction, refer to the "Minotaur Project" book.

Exercises.Name: VALOUR (also called: Protection of valour)
Introduction: Posture of Identity. With hands closed making fists, arms tended along the body, head straight and a serene attitude. The arms rise slowly on the sides and then cross each-other at chest height with firmness and conviction, in the gesture of protecting an inner worth that we know we have. The eyes are open and look ahead, and the legs are slightly open to ensure stability.
This posture refers to the intrinsic valour of every human being as a transcendent creature. It encourages identity dances in which the perception and the vivencia of being oneself are strengthened.
Observation: Take the time with your arms along the body and fists closed before coming to cross them in front of the chest. This GP refers to the ability to have our own feelings, thoughts, feelings and desires. In the variations, the dance always suggest protection and defense (slightly like a martial art).

Exercises.Name: CONNECTION WITH THE INFINITE
Description: Before beginning, feet are parallel (GP of Identity). The left foot is placed in front of the right foot. The arms rise slowly, without lifting the shoulders, the palms facing each other as if trying to reach with your fingertips an imaginary point in the sky. The eyes are open throughout the dance.
Observation: This GP is realized once and then the dance begins with, as a reference, upwards elevation and connection. In the dance, so as to establish a pulse, there are times to return to the posture of identity alternating with variations suggesting ascension.
Objective: This posture generates mystical dances with movements of ascent. It initiates into the mystery.

Exercises.Name: INTIMACY
Introduction: Beginning in the GP of Identity, the hands slowly move towards the chest, with great delicacy, as if protecting the inner universe of our intimacy. The head bows with devotion. The feet are together, and the eyes close when vivencia intensifies.
This movement generates a vivencia of profound intimacy with oneself, as in a desire to fusion with oneself.

The posture promotes dances of recollection and interiority that facilitate the access to the vivencia of intasis (loving implosion, feeling the universe in oneself). It is "the awakening of the most secret part of intimacy" (St Augustine).
Observation: After doing the GP for one minute, the dance proposes variations of intimacy, standing or crouching, in a pulsation between yin/yang, opening/intimacy. It can be proposed to people who have difficulty with the vivencia of intimacy to seek to come into actual contact with their most intimate body parts, the parts which are rarely touched or exhibited, by placing their hands on their own body, by hugging themselves. This suggestion can simply be visible in the demonstration dance of the facilitator.

Exercises.Name: ASKING
Introduction: From the GP of Identity, the right leg is placed in front of the left leg, the left leg is slightly bent at the knee.

The right arm is raised to 140  (approximately up to face level), the palm facing upward. The left arm is held back. The eyes and face are turned with dignity towards the demanding hand. The eyes are open. This posture being somewhat uncomfortable, it must remain dignified.
The posture of asking is, in our culture, even more difficult than those of giving and receiving. Especially for people suffering from an inferiority complex and from fear of rejection.
CIMEBNote: Previously, Rolando indicated that we had to "put down one knee." He changed his mind and the result is that the position is unstable and uncomfortable. When questioned, Rolando said that it is indeed uncomfortable to ask for something, and that when a person needs to ask, it's when in his life itself he is in an unstable and uncomfortable position. It is nevertheless important to highlight the quality of sincerity and dignity of the request (all requests, all desires are good in the sense that their are an expression of life). The posture is done alone. It can be done in two groups so that everyone can be welcomed in an embrace at the end. There is no generated dance.

Exercises.Name: GIVING - GIVING ONESELF
Introduction: These two positions evoke feelings of generosity and selflessness. They are often proposed successively.
Description: Giving:
The feet are apart, the arms slowly open in a forward motion until an angle of 35  (at about hip height). The palms of the hands are opened in a generous gesture of giving. The eyes are open.
Giving oneself:

The movement is identical to the above but it becomes wider: the body arches slightly back, the chest opens, the head is tilted back in a gesture of offering, of the total gift of oneself. The eyes close when vivencia becomes intense. The Generative Posture of giving oneself makes us face the ordeal of offering ourselves to the other unconditionally and without fear.

Exercises.Name: RECEIVING
Introduction: Starting from the GP of Identity, move on immediately to that of Giving. Then, the arms are raised forward at an angle of 90 (about shoulder height) to open on each side in a gesture of receptivity. The eyes are open and feet the are slightly apart.

This gesture completes the preceding one and refers to the balance of the affective function between giving and receiving. In fact, people who only know how to give have as serious problems as those who do not know how to receive.

Exercises.Name: PROTECTING LIFE
Introduction: Standing with feet slightly apart, the posture and movement are as when one rocks a child, slowly and delicately. The eyes are open throughout the dance, in a tender contemplation of the space/cradle formed by one's own arms.

This GP promotes vivencias of tenderness and amazement about everything that is alive. It stimulates feelings of maternity and paternity. It induces a feeling of universal reverence and respect for life.
When doing a free dance with variations following the GP, it should symbolize the care and attention given to all forms of life (a bird, a flower, a troubled person, a blind person, the earth, etc.).

Exercises.Name: WORKING
Introduction: The right arm is held back as if preparing to launch something, with the hand half open. The gesture to do is to give a vigorous impulse, as in order to propel something that is held in the hand. The left arm naturally accompanies the movement balancing and moderating the strength of the other arm. The right leg is towards the back in perfect synergy. The position is similar to that of a discus thrower or a shot putter.
This posture promotes, in the dance that follows, the gestures of manual labor such as work in the fields, in the forest, at sea, and the movements of sport.

This position is interesting to propose for stimulating the synchronicity and eurythmy of the group, in order to create a possibility of producing free choreographies, which are linked to the collective ceremonies of labour in connection with life in the community.
This is in fact done to rehabilitate the dignity of work, the connection between the worker and his work or his artwork.
Carried out with slow motions, these gestures evoke dancing and are of great richness to work on the line of Creativity.
Observation: This GP is not really about "working", but about expressing a stylized form of the gestures of work. As variations, one can dance movements such as: Wear a load on one's back, Pulling a burden, a fishing net, a boat; Hoisting a mast, a sail; Weaving, braiding a rope or a net; Slicing wood with an ax; Digging; Rowing; Harvesting, sowing All kinds of manual work that suggest direct contact between the hands and matter.

Exercises.Name: DETERMINATION
Introduction: The person stands at first in the Generative Posture of Identity. The whole body will move towards the front: it is a step forward in order to place the right foot with the sole laid flat, and with the knee slightly bent. The right arm rises straight ahead to the horizontal position, the hand open with the palm facing down. The left leg is stretched at the back as if preparing for the impulse. The left arm is stretched along the left leg, with the hand open. The glance extends forward as if aiming at a target. Muscle tension will gradually increase with the intensity of the music. The vivencia related to this position is that of a projection into the future, a predisposition to action, to achievement.
Observation: When the muscular tension reaches a level where the transition into action is required, like an arrow, the person starts a determined walk, accompanied by the music. After a short time during which it is possible to experience the vivencia of determination in action, the person returns to the starting position of identity. This posture od determination is a metaphor for the bow drawn towards a goal. The dancer is at the same time the archer, the bow, the arrow and the path.

Exercises.Name: EXPANSION (Cosmic Man)
Introduction: Standing in the GP of Identity, arms relaxed along the body with a serene gaze forward. At the same time, the left foot is moved to the side for a stable and generous opening of the position of the legs, and the fists close and come to rest against each other in front of the chest. Then, the right arm and hand are opened and extended to the side. And the left arm and hand are extended on their side. The gaze follows each time the movement of each hand. A few seconds after holding that position as a star, we return to the starting position.
This posture is based on the drawing of the Vitruvian Man by Leonardo da Vinci. It refers to the cosmic man.

I can only feel as One with the cosmos when I open myself to it. The movement does not stop at the fingertips, but it extends beyond. In the dance that follows the posture and invites for variations, we can move and turn in large movements of expansion, upwards and on the sides. However, one must be careful not to close the fists again, even if one goes back into moments of connection to oneself. This position's essential existential objective is the opening and expansion of identity. A cosmic identity.

Exercises.Name: ATEMPORALITY
Introduction: In the sitting position, with legs bent and soles of the feet facing each other and touching, the hands resting on the legs one over the other, and palms facing upward. The head gently bows forward and relaxes inclined on the chest without tension, without exaggeration. This posture is maintained for about one minute. The person is then invited to lie down in order to relax the back and legs muscles, as this position is mostly unusual in our everyday gestures.

Accompanied by an appropriate music, this posture induces a vivencia of eternity, that is to say the perception of time being expanded, a time without limits, without duration. This is why the generative posture of atemporality can be considered as a form of meditation.

This is a "timeless" vivencia where time is freed of any measure. It is inspired on yoga, and the vivencia comes from the very subtle sensation of the concentration of energy carried out without any effort. For people who have difficulties, they should be invited to adapt to it to their motor possibilities (including doing it sitting on a chair). However, the demonstration by the facilitator must comply with the instructions. This posture is not followed by a dance.

Exercises.Name: CONNECTION TO THE PRIMORDIAL
Introduction: The person takes a squatting position. The eyes are open, and the hands gently caress the ground with tenderness and reverence. The gaze accompanies these gestures.

This posture recalls the manual labors such as the handling of clay, the sorting of seeds, the archaic preparation of food. On the visceral and physiological levels, it recalls the positions of urination, defecation and natural childbirth.

This posture is particularly uncomfortable for the so-called civilized beings of our cities. It is therefore appropriate, on one hand, not to exceed one minute, and on the second, to adapt the posture:
Instead of placing the feet parallel, they can be placed apart, or on the tip of the feet. If the position is still difficult, it is possible to put one knee on the ground.

While the hands caress the ground, small displacements are made while remaining crouched. This GP is particularly suitable for Biodanza in Nature and Biodanza with Clay. At the end of the dance, we propose to lie down on the side for a moment and stretch.

Exercises.Name: FLOATING IN AMNIOTIC FLUID
Introduction: Lying on the side in a fetal position, with eyes closed and mouth half open, the person gently begins to make very slow movements, as a fetus floating in amniotic fluid.

During the exercise, the body slowly turns to the opposite side while being very careful to keep the spine and the head fully rested on the ground. This rolling oscillation to one side and the other can be repeated two or three times according to the regressive induction of the music and the vivencial time of each person.
All movements must evoke the vivencia of flotation.

When turning, while progressively lying on the back, the legs are moving away from each other (like a baby lying on his back with his knees bent up on the belly). The hands are placed near the mouth and nose. The head does not rise from the ground. This position is particularly regressive, it should be proposed in two groups so that each person can be held in a rocking embrace on the ground for about 2.5 minutes.

This exercise induces a vivencia of regression, of returning to the origin of life, to the undifferentiated states of the perinatal period, with the accompanying perceptions: the perception of non-separation, where de-fusion fades away and makes room for an undifferentiated perception.

Exercises.Name: SELF-DONATION (indicated only for women)
Introduction: Lying on her back, the woman opens her legs with knees slightly bent and without stiffness, in a receptive attitude recalling availability and the sexual offering. The arms rest on the sides, slightly away from the trunk, in an attitude of surrender. Eyes are closed and mouth half open.

The person is asked to simply listen to the music until she feels is the impulse to move that comes from within, from the pelvic region. The movements are slow and rhythmic in a search for active receptivity, and they will increase in intensity according to the crescendo of the music. The legs take a half-bent position to allow for the lifting of the pelvis in a pulsating movement, back and forth and rotating, referring to the movements of the sexual offering. These movements should not be mechanical but a response to an inner urge and impulse.

The Generative Posture of Self-donation refers to primitive fertility ceremonies in which women, lying in the freshly plowed furrows, invoked the fertilizing force of heaven manifested in the rain and the sunlight.

This posture often follows that of Connection to the Primordial. As it is indicated for women only, the men present will be invited to accompany them: each man stands in an attitude of deep respect close to a woman. At the end of the dance, with much delicacy and care, he will welcome her in his arms for a protective embrace on the ground.

Sometimes, on the same music and while women perform their dance, we can invite men to repeat the posture of Connection to the Primordial. In any case, this vivencia should be proposed in two groups so that each woman can be held and welcomed at the end of her dance.

This posture can help recovering the sacred meaning of femininity. The person who witnesses this surrender will also be connected to this sacredness, to the greatness of the mystery. When a man contemplates this, he gives thanks for the gift that was given for his eyes to see: the deep femininity of his female companions.
His involvement also strengthens his sense of protection of women who are in a position of total surrender.
The posture is not separated from the dance. In the movements, there is an inner search to find an active expression of receptivity.

Exercises.Name: ENCOUNTERING OUR FELLOW BEING
Introduction: Starting from the position of Identity, the arms stretch forward as the chest opens, in a friendly and receptive attitude of welcoming. Arms open even more and at the same time we make a step forward.

The vivencia stimulates a receptive attitude that is spontaneous and joyful facing others. The realization of this archaic gesture opens us to the possibility of experimenting with new forms of expression of affective connection.

This position awakens in us an expressive form of welcoming, of hospitality: the ability to provide a full information, a wholesome and total welcoming. Daily life and routine often lead us away from the celebration of the other when he arrives in our lives. What is generated by this posture is not really a dance, but rather an encounter (which incidentally is the most appropriate exercise to propose afterwards).

Exercises.Name: HEAVEN-EARTH CONNECTION
Introduction: Starting from the Generative Posture of Identity, the right arm is slowly raised toward the sky at the same that a steward is made with the right foot. The left arm is naturally stretched along the body, with the palm facing the ground, thus forming a diagonal line from the right hand to left hand. The eyes are open or half closed and the mouth is half open.

In this position, the person collects energy from the sky with the right hand, lets it pass through the body, and restores it to the earth with the left hand. The movement is pulsating, light and fluid. To obtain this pulse, the person is invited to do a slow and continuous movement of knee bending and oscillation.
Objective: This generative posture induces the vivencia of being a channel, a medium, a connecting path between heaven and earth. In the symbolism of different cultures the marriage between heaven and earth, the cosmic marriage, represents the union and fertilization between the masculine and the feminine. Some myths and anthropological records refer to this cosmic metaphor: the union between the king and queen, the first two symbols of the I Ching: C'in the Heaven and C'un the Earth.

The generative Posture of Heaven-Earth Connection therefore stimulates the intimate connection with the two great forces of nature: the masculine and the feminine, Yang and Yin. And humans are the place of union of these two polarities or principles.
Remark: The movement is soft, like a light swing accompanied by a gentle rotation. The front right knee (which corresponds to the hand skyward) bends slightly. During the dance, the variations express and recall the opening position (right hand up, left hand down and back with palm facing the ground).

Exercises.Name: EVOCATION AND LIBERATION OF INNER ENERGY
Introduction: Starting from the Generative Posture of Identity, slowly approach both hands to the chest, and lay them on it one over the other in a gesture of intimacy. Then, the arms open slowly at the same time that the chest is slightly thrown forward, so as to allow the expansion of the affective potential. The eyes are closed and the mouth half open.
This posture induces a vivencia of expression of the liberating power of love towards the world.

At the end of the posture and before the dance with variations, the hands come to rest on the chest. During the dance of variations, a pulse is established between the moments of evocation of energy (sensible, hands on chest, connection to self) and those of release and liberation (opening, expansion). In the moments of connection to self, avoid getting hunched as if hiding the chest, which would cause a vivencia of closing.

Exercises.Name: ELEVATION
Introduction: Starting from the posture of Identity, the arms remain close to the body and the forearms are raised outward at a right angle and are slightly open, with palms up and fingers just barely separated. The mouth is half open and the eyes are open. When the vivencia intensifies, the chest opens and the head is slowly and slightly overturned backwards, just to allow the gaze to rise.

This is a subtle gesture that generates a vivencia of elevation and lightness. The idea of elevation refers to an upward force of purity. Such a state of mind is nourished by the possibility of rising above the existential problems of life and have a vision of wholeness, an overall perspective. It is an invitation to see life as a process and not to remain trapped in details.

Exercises.Name: INSPIRATION
Introduction: Starting from the posture of Identity, the left hand comes to rest on the chest. The right hand rises slightly forward, in a highly sensitive gesture, as if to touch the air. The eyes are open and facing forward, without intentionality.

This position generates a state of creative "gestation". It does not refer to the creative act itself (yang in nature) but at the time that precedes it (yin in nature). The left hand on the chest refers to the intimate connection to oneself (inspiration), while the right hand suggests the momentum, the impulse, the beginning of the creative act that is full of sensibility.
The vivencia of inspiration has the quality of the creative ecstasy that feeds on the emotion that is felt when one finds full expression.

It is a gesture that is sketched, which touches the air. This position is so delicate, so minimal, that it is necessary for the affective motor integration to be well integrated. Otherwise, the gesture is meaningless.

The left hand on the heart is precisely referring to the emotional source of creation. It is doing what we feel; the integration between emotion, inspiration and realization. The dance that follows resembles a yin dance, with very sensitive movements and gestures which bring back to the touching of air, with a state of subtly active receptivity.

Exercises.Name: RECEIVING GRACE
Introduction: In the sitting position, with legs crossed (in a semi lotus position), the hands are placed on the knees with palms facing upward. The shoulders are relaxed. The head is slightly thrown back, without exaggeration.
The eyes are closed and the mouth half open.
This posture induces a vivencia of bliss which is manifested by a received gift: the grace of existence itself.

The person may be invaded by a feeling of harmony with its surroundings and, if the vivencia is realized in nature, of harmony with the universe. This posture may also be regarded as a form of meditation.

This posture is not followed by dance. However, there is the possibility of introducing variations when the vivencia intensifies, by adding pulsating movements as softly rocking back and forth or gentle movements of the head. When presenting this posture Rolando often says that the vivencia of grace is "descending", meaning that it comes down into us in response to another "ascending" vivencia, in which our whole being is elevated in an attitude of recognition and grace. In this posture there is nothing to ask, and nothing to expect. Grace is what comes to the one who says thank you.

Exercises.Name: MAGNETISM
Introduction: Standing, the person gently approaches both hands to one another with palms facing. In a pulsating movement, the hands move away and approach carefully without touching and without separating too far.
This gesture should be made a number of times, very slowly, in a search of the perception of the polarized magnetic energy between the two hands.
This posture induces the vivencia of the creation of a sphere of pulsating energy.

The eyes are open and they follow the movement of the hands. The dance that follows consists in a pulsation of this movement with the sphere, which gradually extends to a dance with or within the sphere of energy.

Exercises.Name: ILLUMINATION (Enlightenment)
Introduction: Starting from the Generative Posture of Identity, slowly approach both hands to the chest, and lay them on it one over the other in a gesture of intimacy. The eyes are open. The hands slowly separate and face forward with great sensibility.
This gesture produces a subtle intensification of perception. This generative posture creates a space for contemplation and the revelation of the splendor of the universe.

This posture represents the possible outcome of a deep connection to oneself, in the sense that enlightenment begins with a state of inner clarity. The dance consists of creating a space for contemplation, as if we were also seeing with our hands, with our heart. The state of illumination results in a sensation of lightness and transparency. It is interesting to propose the "Baptism of light" before this generative posture.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF THE SEED
Introduction: The vivencia of "growth" is one of the most profound and beautiful that a human being can experience. It is the capacity to develop every day the unknown or unrevealed potentialities of the inner seed, and to grow until the end of our days, flowering and giving fruit throughout our life. Human life is similar to a tree that grows from a seed and becomes strong and fecundates, nourished from the memorial sap of love. The tree flowers and gives fruits in such a generous way that the branches break with the weight of the fruits, until it dies having given so many fruits.

The process of life is contained within the seed and is transmitted through millions of years of evolution. At each stage new shoots appear, new capacities. At each age we receive the grace of new visions and new growth. All moments of our existence have an intrinsic value that we should learn to discover and unveil all of them.
Description: The person is placed on the ground, in the position of the seed: on her knees, chest fully flexed forward, the forehead to the grown and the arms down under her or around her thighs (following her physical capabilities the position can be adjusted, what is important is that she goes from a "gathered" position into a progressive ascending deployment). It is not a question of "representing" by mimicking the development of a small tree.

It is the music that should provide the impetus to growth, not our will. We must become the music itself and deploy upward from the obscure entrails of the earth to obscure towards the light. "Something" grows in us.
Our wisdom is to allow that ascending energy to manifest itself.
Objective: To reconnect with the infinite possibilities of growing and evolve from our own potential. The exercise of growth leads to a vivencia of exceptional strength.

Exercises.Name: ECLOSION TO LIFE (also called Hatching or Blooming dance)
Description: The dance of Eclosion to life (or "Blooming" dance) is a dance that is very close in its essence to the Dance of the Seed. However, it is performed with accompaniment: with protection and especially with the stimulation offered by the other. It is a companion that stimulates the emergence to life with delicate stimulation and orientation, by caresses and by a very sensitive touch.

The person (the dancer) is placed on the ground in a semi-fetal position (different from the initial position of the dance of the seed, which is kneeling and bent on oneself and in a position of deep connection to the visceral forces that will make possible and natural the ascending expansion that will follow).

In the Dance of Eclosion to life, the position is semi-fetal because it is the presence and stimulation offered by the other (the caregiver) that constitutes the inductive force of the deployment. Forces that do not come from us but from the receptivity to the affective stimuli of the world. Thus, the person who wants to hatch and start his eclosion leaves somewhat behind her own impulses and tendencies to grow by herself. She is not passive but receptive. So she lets herself be carried by the intrinsic strengths of birth and expansion in their encounter with the world.

The caregiver begins to touch the person with care and very delicate movements, sending him his warmth, his touch, his presence. He seeks to enter in profound harmony with the dancer in order to facilitate the movement, which develops gradually until it unfolds and develops. He thus ensures that this deployment takes place in the continuity and fluidity of a natural sequence (like the blossoming of a flower).

These delicate and caressing touches help give support and direction, helping to open and deploy to find the position of lying on her back and totally open, ready to be fertilized by air and light. Continuing to accompany with contact and caresses that give warmth and support, the helper aids with folding the legs (to prepare to get up) and is placed behind the dancer (behind his head) in order to lift the dancer to a sitting position, firmly supporting his back and head. Always through caresses and communicating assurance, the dancer is helped to his feet. In fact, by supporting, the caregiver is placed in position of tutoring giving containment to help the dancer to stand up. As soon as the dancer shows the first attempts to gradually open his eyes, the helper teaches him the first steps, stimulating him to walk, then to dance. To dance life. Then comes the crucial step of communicating the courage and the enchantment of dancing alone, to let go of the hand, to move away in order to dance his own life, not for the companion who helped him, but in the world and for the world.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF CREATION
Introduction: This dance belongs to the line of Creativity, and differs from the dance of Brahma which is purely symbolic.
Here, the person begins in the position of the seed, as described above: coiled upon herself with her head down.

The music "Finlandia" by Sibelius, begins by giving a growing power to the movement. The dancer rises up with a certain energy, and the dance that follows, in coherence with the music, reiterates the cosmogony of the appearance of man.
Description: The origin of the world is an enigma unfathomable by the human mind.

Some eastern religions speak about the intuition of a primordial movement, a first gesture: in this case, creation emerges from a generative dance. In other religions, such as the Judeo-Christian Genesis, the origin of the world is the divine breath, the voice, the breath of life, the word that designates the name of these things, giving them identity and rescuing them from the chaos.
The cosmogonies of different peoples nevertheless have a corporal or spiritual affiliation: spirit, respiration, breath, soul, universal prana.

The dance of Shiva, who destroys and creates the universes, belongs to the cosmogony of movement. The biblical Genesis, which says, In the beginning there was the word, pertains to the cognitive-verbal line.

Possibly these two lines represent the initial options of the drama of consciousness faced with the unfathomable mystery. Moreover, if we are conscious of the intuition of a primordial unity, the bifurcation of the corporal and spiritual makes no sense and will be better represented as an anthropological catastrophe:
the first great dissociation.

Nevertheless, all the cosmogonies start from a unique principle, which later unfolds into a duality, trinity or quaternity. This unique principle can be a solitary creator-god, an unnamed and unintelligible god, the primordial egg, the seed of life, etc. That is to say, it describes the process that goes from unity to diversity and which has been called The Multiple Unity by the philosophers. In the Egyptian cosmogony, the god Ra separates the brothers Nut and Geb, creating the space of life and the heavenly vault. In the East, the Tao is formed by the Ying-Yang duality. In the biblical Genesis, Jehova separates the heavens from the earth, the light from the darkness. The Greek cosmogony intuits the cosmic principles, leading to the quaternity of
Anaximander, formed by the elements Earth, Air, Fire and Water.

The general principle of these cosmogonies consists of progressive differentiation, starting from the unique principle that each diversification creates a more complex reality. In the sense of Teilhard de Chardin, creation will be evolutively perfected, from the simple to the complex, from the undifferentiated to the differentiated, while in the East this process is cyclic and represents the millennial succession of karmic revolutions. In Christianity, this process is linear and developed historically ending with Parousia, the return to God through the Final Judgement.

Opposite to the difficulty of unifying the cosmic experiences is an all-embracing feeling, having taken the most universal elements in order to reproduce, in a dance, the personal vivencia of the creation of the world, the series of movements that lead from chaos to the cosmos. This process, in our conception, does not unfold in a closed or linear cycle; it corresponds to an evolutive model in a logarithmic spiral. The universe, therefore, is perfected through successive processes of integration of vital circuits, each time more differentiated. The integrative mechanism is communal love, the connection with life.
Objective: The aim of the Dance of the Creation is to induce the vivencia of the cosmic creation and awaken in the dance our potentiality and our creative exaltation.
Remark: The total length of the music is 8:33, in the version of Marcelo CD 14. (Former IBF collection)
DanceStages: 1 Primordial Seed
The god-seed, breathing in the cosmic space, begins to awaken and grow, manifesting his potentialities.
2 Fecundation of the spaces with the genital energy
3 Appearance of Duality
Yin Dance and Yang Dance: From the original chaos, separation of the Feminine Principle from the Masculine Principle.
1:02 Yin
1:21 Yang
1:58 Yin-Yang dance
4 Integrated Yin-Yang Dance
Once the duality was formed, the cosmic marriage takes place, the marriage between the feminine and the masculine, between the light and the darkness, between heaven and earth.
3:04 Separation of Heaven and Earth
3:34 Separation of Earth and Waters
5 Creation of the Four Elements
Earth, Water, Fire, and Air. From duality emerges the proliferation of the many, in a process of ever-increasing differentiation.
3:44 Earth
4:04 Water
4:29 Fire
4:50 Air
6 Creation of the Firmament, Creation of Plants and Animals
Cration des plantes et des animaux.
5:00 Creation of the Firmament
5:16 Creation of plants and animals
7 Appearance of Humanity, in Permanent Evolution
8 Formation of the Human Community
7:46 Triumph of Love, until the end

Exercises.Name: GIVING AND RECEIVING A FLOWER
Description: This exercise is done in pairs. A companion makes a gesture of offering the other a flower. The other makes a gesture of receiving it. The gestures mimic taking the flower from the ground, or the air or from some part of the body. The person receiving the flower accepts it and places it in some part of his body. Then the roles are reversed.
Observation: At the same time, this exercise can reveal certain aspects or characteristics of each participant: From which part is the flower taken: from the sky, the earth, the mind or the heart? In what part of their body is it placed when received: the hair, the chest, the belly? In this way, a simple phenomenology is created in the giving and receiving. It has an unconscious symbolic effect, which is directly related to the balance of these two functions.
On the other hand, it is a representation of great affective transference that gives a poetic character to the gesture of giving and receiving a flower.
Objective: To stimulate creative expression, through mimicking gestures and expressivity. This exercise also induces effects of the line of affectivity, establishing a form of gestural communication that expresses the relationship between the acts of giving and receiving. To activate on a symbolic level these two fundamental affective functions.

Exercises.Name: DANCE OF FRIENDSHIP
Introduction: Friendship is one of the noblest human feelings and one of the most profound feelings ever. In friendship affectivity, aesthetic feeling, loyalty and tuning of consciences come together.

When Ronald Laing was asked how he defined a sick man, he replied: "A sick man is a man who has no friends". A person with no true friends is affectively inconsistent. To have a friend is a blessing, a wonderful gift of life.

Friendship is a feeling that leaves the other free. There is no jealousy between friends. There is a deep respect for what the other feels. But friendship is, as we see it, a complex feeling which deepens with time.

Plato said: "In friendship we must be careful not to let the misunderstanding settle and grow." That is to say, that we must learn to take care of our friend. As the Milton Nascimento song says, "a friend is someone that is kept on the left side of the chest."

In friendship, a sort of mental network is created, a code that only friends can understand. The cross fertilization of minds is a very real phenomenon that manifests itself in the intellectual and existential levels.
Friendship is essentially creative.
In Biodanza, we propose the Dance of Friendship with the following sequence:
1. Meeting the friend
2. Watching the world together
3. Opposition
4. Sowing together
5. Gathering together
6. Listen to the heart of the friend
7. Keeping forever the friend in our heart
DanceStages: 1 Discover the friend
A feeling of sympathy and affinity gives rise to friendship. Sometimes, this affinity may be tinted with a certain admiration or some psychological complementarity.

People will choose each-other for this dance. Then, the group mixes and each person wonders around in the world, being available. In a glance, the friends "recognize" and discover each-other, in an progressive encounter and in a reciprocal state of wonder.
2 Watching the world together

It is interesting to observe that, in general and despite their differences, friends have similar or close views of the world. This is one reason why they enjoy being with one another. Feeling truly together brings about a feeling of happiness.
The two set off together to explore the world with the same look, marveling at the same things.
3 Opposition

Friends can eventually go through conflicts and have different views of reality. In such cases, a disagreement appears which, in the dance, results in the confrontation of opposing forces (the forearms opposing each other). Through this dialectic, it will be possible to reach a consensus because the relationship between friends is not rigid. The fight ends with an embrace of reconciliation.
4 Sowing together

To create together, based on the respect of difference, which becomes the richness of the friendship. This stage of the dance is about doing together gestures that evoke certain tasks or projects with common goals, mutual support, complementarity, solidarity and reciprocal initiative.
5 Gathering or harvesting together
